project.title: BORDERLESS TECH CLUB, UNIPORT
project.description:
## INTRODUCTION 
Borderless Tech Club, Uniport is a subset of the B<>rder/ess Dev Hub. This club was created with the aim of training, equipping and empowering young persons in the University of Port Harcourt with Web3 Education, onboarding and in-demand Tech skills.

The Club was established in 2023 and since inception, Borderless UNIPORT, has been very instrumental in the Web3 Education of the University Students. This is the foremost Tech Club in the university when it comes to Web3 onboarding. Annually, over 20 students in Uniport graduate from our cipher sessions where they learn in demand Tech and Web3 skills which includes; Data Analysis, Smart Contract Development, Solidity, Web Development, UI/IX, Cyber Security etc.

### PROJECT OBJECTIVES
1. To Establish a Tech Hub within University is Port Harcourt, providing students with a physical hub for hands-on learning, collaboration, and mentorship in tech and Web3.

2. Enhance Blockchain and Tech Education by hosting regular workshops, hackathons, and training sessions. And by going on air weekly, with the school's radio station to onboard the occupied students who can't come to our hub.

3. Acquire Relevant Facilities (like Projector, Generator etc.) for onsite onboarding at the respective faculties and departments as well as public places like the school‚Äôs convocation arena.

4. Increase Community Engagement by expanding partnerships with local and global blockchain/Web3 communities.

5. Bridge the Knowledge Gap by offering structured programs in Web Development, Solidity, UI/UX design, Data Analysis,, cybersecurity, Digital Marketing and other tech-related tracks.

6. Foster Innovation and Startups by inspiring and supporting student-led Web3 and tech projects through mentorship and incubation.


### PROJECT SCOPE & IMPLEMENTATION
# Phase 1: Securing a Space for the Tech Hub
- Partner with the university administration to allocate a dedicated building for the hub.
- Equip the hub with computers, desk and chairs, internet access, and learning materials.
- Design an operational structure, including scheduled training programs.

# Phase 2: Training & Community Building
- Organize weekly training sessions on blockchain development, Web3 inclusion, smart contracts, and Web3 security.
- Invite Web3 and Tech industry experts for mentorship and coaching sessions.
- Host quarterly hackathons and bootcamps to encourage project development.

# Phase 3: Expanding Impact & Sustainability
- Strengthen collaborations with existing tech and blockchain communities.
- Launch a student-led project incubation program within the University.
- Develop a system for membership and alumni engagement.


# OUR IMPACT
As a Tech Club we have an active WhatsApp community of 240 UNIPORT Students we have onboarded into the Web3 Space. We do this via:

- Hosting Virtual Onboarding Sessions on X Spaces. Here is a few links to the X Spaces we've hosted: Starting your Journey in Web3: Essential Skills and Steps for Newbies (Series): >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1817860969172721834?s=46 https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1814542287164109280?s=46

- We partner with Faculties and Departments in the University to educate and onboard students to Web3 during their Orientation or other programs.

- We were Live at Borderless3.0, not as Guests but we played a Host role in the event. Every Unit had a UNIPORT Member in their team. Social Media Team, Content Team, Media Team, Ushering Team, Developer Team, etc. you can name it. ?>https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337402182652221?s=46

- We have onboarded and trained Newbies who are now experts and are actively educating onboarding newbies into Web3. As a proof of our work, our members volunteered in Gitcoin booth, Bitsave booth, and Movement booth where they were educating and onboarding newbies to Web3: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337406557245794?s=46

- We won the Award of Solidity Developer of the Year and Media Unit Award at Borderless3.0  with both Team Leaders emerging from our Tech Club: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337449658171787?s=46

- We hosted a Picnic in our Campus last year, to welcome many newbies for an unwinding session and onboarded them into Web3: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1799532563238695000?s=46

- Our Members are always Live at Tech Events where they onboard Techies to Web3: >https://x.com/samuelkime5/status/1886408181238096173?s=46

- We did a Web3 Tour on campus to publicize Borderless3.0 and onboarded Newbies to Web3 via Bitsave Protocol: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1847499569682125092?s=46

- We partner with other Tech Communities to volunteer, in their events, be a Speaker and to onboard Newbies into Web3. This was at @ArbitrumPH Event where our Founder educated newbies on Web3 Governance: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839938961445200113?s=46

- We were Live at UNIPORT Parliamentary Week to Educate and onboard the Student Lawmakers on Web3: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1816945860682342552?s=46

- Our Community Members are sought after speakers and Guests in the Tech Community who also onboard newbies during their speaking engagements and most of the Speakers at Borderless3.0, are UNIPORT Students from our Tech Community: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839939043733250109?s=46 >https://x.com/estherpeter_/status/1792933465895104519?s=46

- We educate students on how to leverage the opportunities in Defi, Crypto and Web3 at large. See how much @Debbie got from Pi: >https://x.com/debbie_favy/status/1892551128178429992?s=46

Meet a few of the students we Onboarded that are excelling in their respective fields:

- Nworah Gabriel, (SAGGIO) a Web2 Dev onboarded in Borderless. He is now a Smart Contract Developer and a Solidity Tutor @Borderlesshub: >https://x.com/nworahgabriel?s=21

- Ekeleme Favour (Plutodev) was onboarded as a newbie, and he is currently an Arbitrum Ambassador and a Guardian at ‚ÄòSolana All Stars‚Äô: >https://x.com/ekelemefavour1?s=21

- Esther Peter, a Law Student we onboarded into the Web3 Space. She's now a Web3 Educator, Creator, Social Media Manager and a Researcher: >https://x.com/estherpeter_?s=21

- Stella is a Law student we onboarded to Web3 last year she is now a Virtual Assistant in the Web3 Space: >https://x.com/ma_ris_st_el_la?s=21

- Jessica is a Biochemistry student in the University of Port Harcourt. We onboarded her to Web3 and taught her UI/UX design during our cipher session: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839938987974086989?s=46

- Debbie is a Medical Student and a newbie we onboarded to Web3 last year. She's now a full-time Web3 Writer: >https://x.com/debbie_favy?s=21


# EXPECTED OUTCOMES
- A fully functional Tech Hub within the university.
- Training of over 100+ students in Web3, blockchain and general tech skills annually.
- Acquisition of facilities for onsite onboarding at the respective faculties and departments.
- Launching of Student's oriented solutions for different faculties in the University.
- Increased student participation in local and global hackathons.
- Stronger partnerships with leading blockchain communities and companies.
- Support for student-led blockchain and tech startups.

- Launching of Student's oriented solutions for different faculties in the University.
- Increased student participation in local and global hackathons.
- Stronger partnerships with leading blockchain communities and companies.
- Support for student-led blockchain and tech startups.

project.title: Callum Trace
project.description:
I am Callum, a DeFi trader and dedicated tech contributor, focused on empowering Nigerian university students to participate in the decentralized future. My work involves creating educational resources and onboarding strategies to illustrate DeFi and Web3 technologies, leveraging my experience in testnet environments to provide practical insights.

**Accomplishments:**

* **Gitcoin Booth Onboarding Success (Borderless 3.0):**
    * At the Borderless 3.0 event, I played a key role in the Gitcoin booth, successfully onboarding over 50 participants to contribute to projects during the GG22 round. This involved providing clear explanations of the Gitcoin Grants process and guiding individuals through the donation process. This experience demonstrated my ability to effectively communicate complex Web3 concepts to a diverse audience and drive active participation in decentralized funding initiatives.
    * Relevant link: [https://x.com/Callum_Trace/status/1858051722578444721](https://x.com/Callum_Trace/status/1858051722578444721) (A tweet showing my work at the gitcoin booth)
* **Web3 Education and Testnet Onboarding (University Setting):**
    * Within my university environment, I have actively onboarded fellow students to the Web3 ecosystem by demystifying key concepts like testnets and protocol interaction. Through clear and concise explanations, I have empowered students to engage with various testnet protocols, fostering a practical understanding of decentralized technologies. This initiative has helped to build foundational knowledge and practical skills among my peers, encouraging further exploration of the Web3 space.

**Community Engagements:**

* My dedication to fostering Web3 communities is evident through my active participation in the Borderless Tech Club at UNN, where I consistently attend and engage in most of the events that have been held.
* Furthermore, I serve as a moderator for the Shot Caller Alpha community, playing a crucial role in providing comprehensive orientation and onboarding for newcomers to the Web3 space. This involves guiding individuals through the complexities of the ecosystem, ensuring they have the necessary knowledge and resources to participate effectively.
* Relevant links:
    * [https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1781320793793634744](https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1781320793793634744) (One of the earliest borderless tech events I attended)

**Funding Goals and How the Funds Will Be Used:**

Funding will significantly amplify my ability to teach Web3 education in Nigerian universities by enabling the creation of easy-to-understand learning materials, expansion of hands-on onboarding initiatives, and the fostering of thriving campus-based Web3 communities. This will include organizing regional events to reach more ears, ultimately empowering the next generation of Nigerian Web3 contributors and accelerating the adoption of decentralized technologies within the Nigeria.

project.title: Derrick Muolokwu
project.description:
Introduction:
Greetings! I‚Äôm Derrick Muolokwu Chinecherem‚Äîa dynamic blend of creativity, diligence, and optimism, fueled by a passion for growth and collaboration. My optimism isn‚Äôt blind idealism‚Äîit‚Äôs a deliberate choice to see potential where others see roadblocks. Whether refining a design prototype or navigating the complexities of decentralized technology, I‚Äôm driven by curiosity and a commitment to iterative growth. Beyond pixels and prototypes, I‚Äôm a community architect, someone who values human connection as much as technical excellence.

What I Do:
As a UI/UX Designer specializing in the Web3 ecosystem, I bridge the gap between artistic intuition and functional design. My work revolves around crafting user-centric interfaces that simplify blockchain technology, making it accessible and engaging for diverse audiences. Every wireframe, every user journey map, is an opportunity to merge form and function‚Äîa philosophy honed through years of balancing Design studies with tech-driven experimentation.

My dedication extends beyond design tools. For years, I‚Äôve been an active pillar of the Borderless Tech Club at the University of Nigeria, Nsukka, where I‚Äôve contributed to initiatives like the Borderless Tour 2.0 & 3.0. These campaigns weren‚Äôt just events; they were movements to ignite curiosity, onboard passionate minds into tech, and foster a tight-knit community of innovators.I‚Äôve consciously chosen to invest exclusively in Borderless Tech Club, championing its vision both online and offline. Whether through social media advocacy or hands-on workshops, my support is unwavering‚Äîa testament to my belief in depth over breadth.

In everything, I aim to leave a legacy of empowerment: designing not just interfaces, but futures; building not just communities, but ecosystems where people and ideas flourish.

answers.answer:
Blockchain University of Port Harcourt is a campus-based club dedicated to bridging the knowledge gap between students and blockchain technology.

We aim to educate the student community about cryptocurrencies and blockchain, empowering them with the skills to navigate and contribute to the evolving digital economy.

Blockchain Uniport's Qualitative and Quantitative Impact  

Qualitative Impact:

1. Skill Empowerment: We have equipped students with valuable skills like Web3 marketing, UI/UX design, technical writing, and smart contract development, preparing them for careers in the blockchain industry.
  
2. Community Building: We've fostered a strong, engaged community passionate about blockchain and Web3, creating an enabling environment for learning, networking, and collaboration.  

3. Awareness and Education: Through workshops, Twitter Spaces, and webinars, we have promoted blockchain concepts, making the technology more accessible and understandable to students from diverse fields.  

4. Bridging Academia and Industry: Our collaborations with industry leaders and organizations have created opportunities for real-world application, bridging the gap between academic knowledge and industry demands. 

5. Mentorship and Guidance: We have provided mentorship to students interested in Web3, guiding them through their learning journeys and helping them navigate career paths in the blockchain ecosystem.  


Quantitative Impact:

1. Community Size: We have a thriving community of around 2,000 members actively engaging in our events, webinars, and online discussions. 

2. Events and Workshops: We have successfully organized and co-hosted multiple Twitter Spaces, webinars, and in-person events, including one of the largest blockchain-themed events in Port Harcourt.  

3. Partnerships: Collaborations with notable industry players like Ethereum Foundation, Borderlessdev, Algorand, Avalanche, etc, have strengthened our community‚Äôs network and opportunities.

4. Hackathon Participation: Our members have participated in hackathons and hands-on projects, gaining practical experience in Web3 technology. 
 
5. Mentorship Reach: We have mentored dozens of students, helping them develop career-relevant skills in blockchain and Web3.

6. Social Media Presence: Our active online presence, including X (Twitter), Telegram, Instagram, WhatsApp and LinkedIn, has amplified our reach, spreading blockchain awareness to a broader audience.  

Our impact is evident in the skills and knowledge gained by our members and in the connections we've built within the global Web3 ecosystem. These contributions not only support individual growth but also promote the larger adoption and understanding of blockchain technology.

project.title: Blockchain University of Port Harcourt
project.description:
Who We Are

Blockchain University of Port Harcourt is a campus-based club dedicated to bridging the knowledge gap between students and blockchain technology.

We aim to educate the student community about cryptocurrencies and blockchain, empowering them with the skills to navigate and contribute to the evolving digital economy.

By organizing events, workshops, and mentorship programs, we have raised awareness and understanding of blockchain technology among students, fostering a knowledgeable community. ‚Äã

Our Contributions To The Web3 Ecosystem

1. Education and Training: We have hosted and co-hosted multiple Twitter Spaces and webinars, introducing students to various Web3 and Blockchain projects and ecosystems. 

Our community of around 2000 members provides opportunities for learning and earning for both tech and non-tech enthusiasts.

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1709490975393841216

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1593170885493817345


2. Skill Development: Through hands-on projects, participating in hackathons, and mentorship programs, we have equipped participants with technical skills like web3 marketing, UI/UX design, technical writing, smart contract development, etc. 

Our experience prepares them for careers in the Web3 industry.

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/blockchain-uniport_blockchainuniport-yearinreview-blockchaineducation-activity-7279867744576024576-9561

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1716089720826994820

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1711639789122818218


3. Community Building: We have hosted one of the largest blockchain-themed events in Port Harcourt, Nigeria.

https://techblit.com/index.php/event/blockchain-day/


4. Partnerships and Collaborations: We have collaborated with various industry leaders and organizations to create opportunities for real-world application, workshops/trainings, networking, and exposure to the larger blockchain ecosystem. These partnerships also help bridge the gap between academia and the industry.

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1773610831781020108

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1815373297430724983

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1726551368838893786

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1737046121703162004

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1598939708528029697

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1897573896699650533

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1579009147475226624

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1634823895252336642

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1836771025855402239

We also conducted a workshop in collaboration with Ethereum Foundation; https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1766500628959043630

5. Mentorships for Students: We have provided mentorship training for students who are interested in Web3 and Blockchain technology.

https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1820435971566875084

Why We Need a Grant

At Blockchain Uniport, our mission is to bridge the knowledge gap between students and blockchain technology. 

With this grant, we can elevate our impact, empower more students, and contribute more significantly to the growth and development of the Web3 ecosystem. It would help us:

1. Scale Educational Programs: With additional funding, we can host larger workshops, advanced training sessions, and more comprehensive mentorship programs, accommodating a broader range of students, including those from non-technical backgrounds.


2. Enhance Community Building: Organizing more impactful events, such as conferences, meetups and hackathons, will foster deeper community connections and provide networking opportunities with industry leaders.


3. Support Student Projects: A grant would allow us to provide resources, incentives, and funding for student-led blockchain projects, encouraging creativity and innovation within the Web3 ecosystem.


4. Increase Accessibility: We want to make blockchain education accessible to more students, including those from underrepresented backgrounds, by covering registration fees for events, offering scholarships, and providing online resources.

Onboarding University Students at Borderless 3.0 (November 2023): I performed at the Borderless Public Goods Concert (Borderless 3.0) as part of the duo JI (Jerry and Ifeanyi), engaging 1,880+ attendees, mostly university students from Rivers State University, Ignatius Ajuru University, UNIPORT and NIIT. My performance created an inclusive atmosphere, encouraging students to participate in Web3 onboarding activities like the Gitcoin booth, where I helped them set up crypto wallets and make on-chain donations. I also invited friends from these universities, onboarding three into the Borderless Cipher Session, with others joining the community.  

Educating University Students Through Threads on X: I created educational threads on X to simplify Web3 concepts for university students, including a 12-post thread promoting Borderless 3.0, a thread on XDegen for safe DeFi trading, and a thread on UpRock and DePIN infrastructure. These threads reached 1,650+ users, many from African universities, and onboarded 70-100 students.  

Link to Posts: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985 (This post is part of a 12-post thread promoting Borderless 3.0, with images showing the event and student engagement).  

XDegen Thread: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1901765931027619892 (reached 600+ users, onboarded 15-20 students, 32 engagements via likes/replies).  

UpRock and DePIN Thread: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1903945107142762511 (reached 50+ users, onboarded 3-5 students).





Building a Web3 Community for University Students Through Web3 Clan: I created and moderate the Web3 Clan WhatsApp community, targeting African university students. The community grew to 160+ members, onboarding 100+ students through shared resources, bounty guidance, and event updates.  

Supporting Career Development for University Students: As a Virtual Assistant for Borderless, I compiled a list of Web3 job opportunities, connecting 50-70 university students to roles like blockchain analysts and UI/UX designers.

answers.answer:
Onboarding University Students at Borderless 3.0 (November 2023)
Activity Description: I contributed significantly to blockchain education at the Borderless Public Goods Concert (Borderless 3.0), a major Web3 event focused on onboarding African university students. As a performer in the duo JI (Jerry and Ifeanyi), I delivered an acoustic set that engaged 1,880+ attendees, many of whom were university students from Rivers State University, Ignatius Ajuru University, and NIIT. My performance created a welcoming atmosphere, encouraging students to participate in onboarding activities like the Gitcoin booth, where they learned about public goods and made their first on-chain donations. As a volunteer, I directly guided students at the booth, helping them set up crypto wallets and engage with Web3. I also invited my friends from these universities, onboarding three into the Borderless Cipher Session, with others joining the Borderless community.

Quantitative Impact:  
Engaged 1,880+ attendees, primarily university students.  

Directly onboarded 10 - 20 students into Web3 by guiding them at the Gitcoin booth (estimated based on booth interactions).  

Onboarded 3 friends into the Borderless Cipher Session, with others joining the community.

Qualitative Impact:  
Made Web3 approachable for non-technical university students through music, with attendees noting that the performance made the event more engaging and encouraged them to explore Web3 activities (e.g., a friend from Ignatius Ajuru University said, ‚ÄúI never thought blockchain could be this accessible!‚Äù).  


My role as a performer and volunteer is documented in the application, with photos of the event showing students engaging with Web3 activities.

Educating University Students Through Threads on X
Activity Description: I‚Äôve created educational threads on X to onboard university students into Web3 and promote blockchain education, targeting students at African universities like Rivers State University. These threads simplify Web3 concepts and encourage participation in blockchain initiatives:  
Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain Event Thread: Promoted the Borderless 3.0 event, highlighting its focus on blockchain mastery and AI innovation, encouraging students to attend and engage with Web3 workshops (x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985).  

XDegen for Newbies Thread: Explained XDegen, a platform for safe DeFi trading, providing beginner-friendly education on Web3 tools (https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1901765931027619892).  

UpRock and DePIN Infrastructure Thread: Educated users on UpRock and Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks (DePIN), explaining how to contribute to decentralized web data infrastructure for AI and earn rewards (https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1903945107142762511).

Quantitative Impact:  
Borderless 3.0 thread reached 1,000+ users, driving 50-70 university students to attend the event, where many were onboarded (based on thread replies).  

XDegen thread reached 600+ users, onboarding 15-20 university students (estimated from messages about setting up XDegen accounts), with 32 users engaging via likes/replies.  

UpRock thread reached 50+ users, onboarding 3-5 university students (based on feedback from users who joined UpRock).  

Total: Reached 1,650+ users, onboarded 70-100 university students into Web3 through educational content.

 Educating University Students Through Threads on X
Activity Description: I‚Äôve created educational threads on X to onboard university students into Web3 and promote blockchain education, targeting students at African universities like Rivers State University. These threads simplify Web3 concepts and encourage participation in blockchain initiatives:  
Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain Event Thread: Promoted the Borderless 3.0 event, highlighting its focus on blockchain mastery and AI innovation, encouraging students to attend and engage with Web3 workshops (x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985).  

XDegen for Newbies Thread: Explained XDegen, a platform for safe DeFi trading, providing beginner-friendly education on Web3 tools (https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1901765931027619892).  

UpRock and DePIN Infrastructure Thread: Educated users on UpRock and Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks (DePIN), explaining how to contribute to decentralized web data infrastructure for AI and earn rewards (https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1903945107142762511).

Quantitative Impact:  
Borderless 3.0 thread reached 1,000+ users, driving 50-70 university students to attend the event, where many were onboarded (based on thread replies).  

XDegen thread reached 600+ users, onboarding 15-20 university students (estimated from messages about setting up XDegen accounts), with 32 users engaging via likes/replies.  

UpRock thread reached 50+ users, onboarding 3-5 university students (based on feedback from users who joined UpRock).  

Total: Reached 1,650+ users, onboarded 70-100 university students into Web3 through educational content.

Qualitative Impact:  
Simplified complex Web3 concepts (e.g., DeFi trading, DePIN infrastructure) for university students, making blockchain education accessible. Users commented that the threads were ‚Äúeasy to understand‚Äù and motivated them to explore Web3 tools (e.g., a Rivers State University student said, ‚ÄúThanks for explaining XDegen, I‚Äôm trying it out!‚Äù).  

Increased awareness of Web3 opportunities among African university students, aligning with the round‚Äôs goal of fostering blockchain education.

Evidence:  
Borderless 3.0 thread: x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985.  

XDegen thread: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1901765931027619892.  

UpRock thread: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1903945107142762511.  

Engagement metrics (likes, replies, DMs) are visible on the threads, showing user interaction and interest.

 Building a Web3 Community for University Students Through Web3 Clan

Activity Description: I created and moderate the Web3 Clan WhatsApp community with my brother Ateh, focusing on blockchain education and onboarding for African university students, particularly from Rivers State University, Ignatius Ajuru University, and NIIT. 

The community includes groups like Blockchain Resources (sharing educational materials), Web3 Bounty Hub (teaching bounty applications and thread contests), and Tech Events and Webinars (promoting Web3 events). I share my experiences from attending 20+ Web3 events (e.g., Borderless, Solana All-Stars, Lisk) to guide students.  

Quantitative Impact:  
Grew the Web3 Bounty Hub group from 70+ to 160 members, mostly university students.  

Onboarded 100+ university students by sharing resources, teaching bounty applications, and promoting events.  


Qualitative Impact:  
Built a supportive community where African university students felt empowered to learn Web3, with members appreciating the practical guidance


Evidence:  
The Web3 Clan WhatsApp community exists and can be verified by joining the group (though I cannot share the link publicly due to privacy). Screenshots of the group is available in the Notion document.  

Supporting Career Development for University Students in Web3
Activity Description: As a Virtual Assistant for the Borderless community, I researched and compiled a list of remote Web3 job opportunities (e.g., smart contract developers, blockchain analysts, UI/UX designers) tailored to the skills of Borderless members, many of whom are university students from Rivers State University, Ignatius Ajuru University, and NIIT. The list was shared via email, supporting career development in Web3.  

Quantitative Impact:  
Connected 50-70 university students to Web3 career opportunities.  

10 students reported applying to roles like blockchain analysts and UI/UX designers (based on email feedback).

Qualitative Impact:  
Empowered university students by providing access to Web3 job opportunities, boosting their confidence to pursue careers in blockchain 



Evidence:  
The job list was shared via email with Borderless Ma KarlaGod, the screenshot is available in the Notion document.
answers.question: Please provide any clear Proof Of Work (PoW) on Blockchain Education activities or OSS Building activities in line with the Round Funding Focus.

answers.answer: I have been an active member of the Borderless Web3 Community since November 2023, contributing to its mission of fostering blockchain education and onboarding university students into Web3. Over the past 16 months, I‚Äôve supported both the Borderless community and the broader Public Goods ecosystem through my roles as a performer, volunteer, content creator, Virtual Assistant, and community moderator. Below are my key contributions, with measurable impacts Onboarding University Students at Borderless 3.0 (November 2023)   Contribution to Borderless: I participated in the Borderless Public Goods Concert (Borderless 3.0) as a performer in the duo JI (Jerry and Ifeanyi), delivering an acoustic set that engaged 1,880+ attendees, many of whom were university students from Rivers State University, Ignatius Ajuru University, and NIIT. My performance created a welcoming atmosphere, encouraging students to participate in onboarding activities like the Gitcoin booth, where I helped 20-30 students set up crypto wallets and engage with Web3. I also invited my friends from these universities, onboarding three into the Borderless Cipher Session, with others joining the community.    Contribution to Public Goods Ecosystem: By guiding students at the Gitcoin booth, I facilitated their first on-chain donations, introducing them to the concept of funding public goods through Web3.    Promoting Borderless Through Educational Content on X   Contribution to Borderless: I created a 12-post thread on X to promote the Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain event, highlighting its focus on blockchain mastery and AI innovation, and inviting university students to attend (x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985). The thread reached 1,000+ users and drove 50-70 students to the event, where many were onboarded through workshops.    Contribution to Public Goods Ecosystem: The event included a Gitcoin booth, and by promoting attendance, I indirectly supported public goods education, as students learned about and contributed to community-driven funding initiatives.    Impact:   Quantitative: Reached 1,000+ users, onboarded 50-70 university students into Web3 through event attendance.    Qualitative: Increased awareness of Borderless‚Äôs initiatives among African university students, with users commenting that the thread motivated them to explore Web3 (e.g., ‚ÄúThanks for sharing, I‚Äôll be at Borderless 3.0!‚Äù).  Building Community Through the Web3 Clan WhatsApp Group   Contribution to Borderless: I created and moderate the Web3 Clan WhatsApp community, which supports Borderless‚Äôs goal of building Web3 communities among African university students. I share educational resources, teach bounty applications, and promote Borderless events, growing the Web3 Bounty Hub group from 70+ to 160 members, onboarding 100+ newbies, many of whom are university students connected to Borderless.    Contribution to Public Goods Ecosystem: I encouraged members to participate in Gitcoin bounties, with 5 earning through such initiatives, some of which support public goods.    Impact:   Quantitative: Onboarded 100+ newbies into Web3, with 5 earning through bounties.    Qualitative: Fostered a supportive community aligned with Borderless‚Äôs mission, with members appreciating the guidance.  Career Grooming for Borderless Members   Contribution to Borderless: As a Virtual Assistant, I researched and compiled a list of remote Web3 job opportunities (e.g., smart contract developers, blockchain analysts) for Borderless members, many of whom are university students, connecting 50-70 to career opportunities.    Contribution to Public Goods Ecosystem: By helping students secure Web3 roles, I indirectly supported the Public Goods ecosystem by increasing the number of contributors who can build and fund public goods projects.    Impact:   Quantitative: Connected 50-70 students to Web3 career opportunities, with 10 applying to roles.    Qualitative: Empowered Borderless members.  Educating on Web3 Tools Supporting Public Goods   Contribution to Borderless: I wrote threads on Web3 tools like XDegen and UpRock, onboarding 15-20 and 3-5 university students, respectively, many of whom are part of the Borderless community.    Contribution to Public Goods Ecosystem: The UpRock thread educated users on contributing to decentralized web data infrastructure for AI, a public good.  Impact:   Quantitative: Onboarded 18-25 students into Web3 tools (15-20 via XDegen, 3-5 via UpRock).    Qualitative: Increased understanding of public goods in Web3, with users noting the thread‚Äôs clarity.  Summary of Support:   Borderless: I‚Äôve onboarded 170-200 university students into Web3 through Borderless-related activities (20-30 at Borderless 3.0, 50-70 via the thread, 100+ via Web3 Clan), engaged 1,880+ students at events, and connected 50-70 to Web3 careers, strengthening Borderless‚Äôs mission of blockchain education in African universities.   Educated users on tools like UpRock that contribute to decentralized infrastructure.

project.title: Ifeanyichukwu Maulepe Ugoji
project.description:
I‚Äôm Ifeanyichukwu Maulepe Ugoji, a Virtual Assistant, Content Creator, Guitarist, Performer, and a passionate Web3 Contributor based at Rivers State University in Nigeria. Since joining the Borderless Web3 Community in November 2023, I‚Äôve dedicated myself to bridging the gap between African university students and the Web3 ecosystem. As a student myself, I understand the challenges my peers face in accessing Web3 education, especially for non-technical students. I combine my creative talents with my commitment to education to make Web3 accessible, engaging, and inclusive for university communities.

What I‚Äôm About: My work focuses on simplifying complex Web3 concepts, building supportive communities, and creating opportunities for students to explore Web3 careers. Over the past 16 months, I‚Äôve impacted students from Rivers State University, Ignatius Ajuru University UNIPORT, and NIIT by onboarding 190-230 students into Web3 through events, educational content, and community-building. 

I‚Äôve engaged 1,880+ students at events like Borderless 3.0, reached 1,650+ users through educational threads on X, grown my Web3 Clan WhatsApp community to 160+ members, and connected 50-70 students to Web3 job opportunities.

My approach is inclusive - I use music, storytelling, and community engagement to make Web3 approachable for students from diverse academic backgrounds, ensuring no one is left behind in the Web3 revolution . 

What Impact I Aim to Achieve:
My goal is to onboard 1,000 African university students into Web3 over the next two years, creating a network of Web3-educated youth who can navigate this complex world of Web3

To achieve this, I plan to:  Perform at Web3 events in Port Harcourt: I aim to perform at major Web3 event in Port Harcourt, to draw university students into Web3 education. Building on my success at Borderless 3.0, where my performance engaged 1,880+ attendees and led to 20-30 students being onboarded, I‚Äôll use music to create an inclusive atmosphere at events like the upcoming Borderless 4.0 event and future Borderless gatherings.

By performing at 5-7 events annually, I estimate engaging 3,000-5,000 university students over the next two years, onboarding 300-500 through event workshops and follow-up activities (e.g., joining Borderless community and participating in cipher sessions). This will amplify Web3 education in universities across Port Harcourt, fostering a culture of blockchain participation. 

Scale Web3 Education Through Content: By enhancing my content creation, I plan to reach 500+ university students per video through talking head videos  on X, onboarding 150-225 more students in the next 6 months.  

Grow University Communities: I‚Äôll expand my Web3 Clan community by 300+ university student members over the next year, providing resources, bounty opportunities, and event updates to onboard 500+ students by 2026.  Support Career Development: I aim to connect 200+ university students to Web3 career opportunities by 2026, building on my past impact of connecting 50-70 students to roles like blockchain analysts and UI/UX designers.

Regarding onboarding and education, we successfully onboarded over 3,000 individuals across Rivers State and more than 1,000 students at Rivers State University (RSU) between 2023 and 2025. Furthermore, in terms of community engagement, we have hosted numerous online and in-person meetups, fostering a vibrant community of blockchain enthusiasts and facilitating valuable networking and knowledge sharing.

project.title: Blockchain Club RSU
project.description:
Blockchain Club RSU is a student-led community dedicated to establishing and nurturing blockchain expertise at Rivers State University. Our core mission is to:

1. Onboard Students: Introduce and educate students on blockchain technology's fundamentals and diverse applications.

2. Equip Students: Provide the practical knowledge, essential tools, and valuable resources necessary for students to actively engage with and contribute to the dynamic blockchain space.

Our project aims to deliver a significant impact in the following areas:

1. Educational Impact:

- Increase blockchain literacy among the student body.
- Foster a deeper understanding of decentralized technologies and their potential.
- Bridge the crucial gap between academic theory and real-world blockchain applications.

2. Career and Skill Development Impact:

- Equip students with highly marketable skills in a rapidly expanding industry.
- Enhance students' employability in diverse blockchain-related fields.
- Create tangible opportunities for students to participate in meaningful blockchain projects and initiatives.

- Community and Innovation Impact:

- Build a robust and vibrant blockchain community within the university.
- Encourage collaborative efforts and drive innovation in blockchain development.
- Contribute significantly to the growth of the regional blockchain ecosystem.

Proof of Our Commitment and Impact:
Over the past three years, Blockchain Club RSU has demonstrated consistent dedication through:

1. Organizing numerous events, meetups, and comprehensive online and offline classes, both on and off campus.

2. Actively participating in hackathons across various blockchain ecosystems.
Hosting the First South-South Celo Africa Meet-Up: ( https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-ZAf_uLt-7FvsASB-qh1BH_1WdTlqOYk?usp=drive_link )

3. Hosting our First Blockchain Conference in partnership with B<>rder/ess and many other projects: ( https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1uRUvos1-av8hySvbg9uTqlOzuFUifXt2?usp=drive_link )

4. Campus Events Organized by the Team: ( https://photos.app.goo.gl/UoxfPmrof5AY1JGo8 )

Recent Achievements and Future Plans:
In the first quarter of 2025, we solidified strategic partnerships with leading projects Roqqu and Avalanche:

- https://x.com/blockchainrsu_/status/1899402395374764113 
- https://x.com/blockchainrsu_/status/1894963410531389650

Furthermore, we are deeply committed to supporting our student community. Through our "BCR School Fees Aid" project, we provided financial assistance for school fees, scaling from 900,000 Naira to 2 million Naira in late 2024 and Q1 2025, in partnership with Roqqu.
- https://x.com/blockchainrsu_/status/1898460525589352813

Looking ahead to the second quarter of 2025, we plan to host a larger-scale second blockchain conference, building on the success of our previous events.

answers.question: Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?

answers.answer:
Blockchain University of Nigeria (BlockchainUNN) is a university blockchain club at the University of Nigeria dedicated to educating students on all about of Blockchain, Web3 and tech generally.

THE BLOCKCHAINUNN IMPACT

Since our launch in 2021, we have onboarded about 7000+ students, lecturer and community members into the ecosystem via annual Conferences, educational bootcamps, workshops, hackathons and trainings.

- We've trained over 150+ Web2 and Web3/blockchain devs in our recurring developer bootcamps, our community members have won hackathons, built projects and are doing a lot in the ecosystem currently.

- We have organized 2 FREE solid Web3/Solidity Blockchain developer bootcamp cohorts (Mainly on Solidity), and our devs are now grounded in blockchain development with most working for various ecosystems now.

- We have equally organized two FREE Web2 developer Bootcamp cohorts (teaching Html, CSS, JS & React) too.

- We have hosted 2 hacker houses with over 30+ projects being built during these hacker houses, and some have gone Live, gotten users and raised money.

- We have hosted 3 editions of the annual Blockchain conferences since our inception in 2021. Each garners an attendance of 3000+ IRL presence on average.

- We've partnered with and have been working closely with Avalanche, Arbitrum, The Graph, Cartesi, Lisk, Web3bridge on a lot of initiatives.

- We were recently highlighted in a magazine published by Greenpill at the ETHCC event in Brussels, Belgium üáßüá™ in 2024 with the support of our partner, Web3bridge

- We have inspired lots of students in other Nigerian campuses to setup blockchain clubs in their schools.

project.title: BlockchainUNN (Blockchain University of Nigeria).
project.description:
Blockchain University of Nigeria (BlockchainUNN) is a university blockchain club at the University of Nigeria dedicated to educating students on all about of Blockchain, Web3 and tech generally. 

# THE BLOCKCHAINUNN STORY


- Since our launch in 2021, we have onboarded about 7000+ students, lecturer and community members into the ecosystem via [annual Conferences](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1853796820063023452?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [educational bootcamps](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1855960913339113794?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [workshops](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1882331591147675978?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), hackathons and trainings. 

- We've trained over 150+ Web2 and Web3/blockchain devs in our recurring developer bootcamps, our community members have won hackathons, built projects and are doing a lot in the ecosystem currently.

-  We have organized 2 FREE solid Web3/Solidity Blockchain developer bootcamp cohorts (Mainly on Solidity), and our devs are now grounded in blockchain development with most working for various ecosystems now.

-  We have equally organized two FREE Web2 developer Bootcamp cohorts (teaching Html, CSS, JS & React) too.

- We have hosted 2 [hacker houses](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1851689026413379629?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg) with over 30+ projects being built during these hacker houses, and some have gone Live, gotten users and raised money.

- We have hosted 3 editions of the annual Blockchain conferences since our inception in 2021. Each garners an attendance of 3000+ IRL presence on average.

- We've partnered with and have been working closely with [Avalanche](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1796080691471368452?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [Arbitrum](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1850835737349919197?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [The Graph](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1809207717069742293?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [Cartesi](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1825805134158352665?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [Lisk](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1882840262793183683?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), Web3bridge on a lot of initiatives.
 
- We were recently highlighted in a magazine published by Greenpill [at the ETHCC event in Brussels, Belgium  üáßüá™](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1815648730818691550?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg) in 2024 with the support of our partner, Web3bridge 

- We have inspired lots of students in other Nigerian campuses to setup blockchain clubs in their schools.


# SOME HACKATHON WINS BY MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY (DEVS WE TRAINED IN OUR BOOTCAMPS)

- We were recently highlighted in a magazine published by Greenpill [at the ETHCC event in Brussels, Belgium  üáßüá™](https://x.com/blockchainunn/status/1815648730818691550?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg) in 2024 with the support of our partner, Web3bridge 

- We have inspired lots of students in other Nigerian campuses to setup blockchain clubs in their schools.

project.title: Designbyog
project.description:
I‚Äôm Godday Obakpolor, a **Graphic Designer with 3 years of experience**, specializing in **branding and visual identity for Web3, DAOs, and public goods projects**. I‚Äôve worked with top organizations crafting impactful designs that help projects *communicate their mission and engage communities effectively through **Designbyog**.


Designbyog is a **design collective dedicated to enhancing the aesthetics of Web3**. It provides *branding, graphic design, and creative direction* for blockchain projects, DAOs, and public goods initiatives to ensure a **strong and professional visual presence** in the decentralized space.


I believe *great design* is essential for accessibility, engagement, and trust in Web3. I aim to bring clarity and creativity to public goods initiatives by crafting high-quality branding, impactful visuals, and engaging storytelling.


# Skills & Expertise
* **Branding & Visual Identity** ‚Äì Crafting strong, recognizable brand assets.
* **Social Media & Marketing Graphics** ‚Äì Creating visuals for Web3 campaigns.
* **Infographics & Data Visualization** ‚Äì Designing clear, engaging explainers.


# Experience


## Graphic Designer ‚Äì Web3 & Public Goods (3 Years)
* Designed branding and identity assets for public goods platforms.
* Created marketing and social media visuals to increase engagement.
* Developed infographics and visual explainers to simplify complex Web3 concepts.


## Freelance Branding Designer
* Worked with DAOs, blockchain startups, and public goods initiatives to build visual identities.
* Designed logos, brand guides, and marketing materials to establish a strong brand presence.
* Created event branding and promotional content for Web3 projects.


# Notable Collaborations
I have created impactful designs that enhance user experience and engagement.

project.title: Ukah, Emeka (D3xter)
project.description:
As a dedicated Web3 community manager, I have been active in building and nurturing a vibrant ecosystem of developers, content marketers, designers and newbies. My work focuses on onboarding individuals into the Web3 space through educational spaces, interactive hangouts, and engagement strategies that foster long-term participation.  

I am #Ukah Chukwuemeka (D3xter), a graduate of Veterinary Medicine from the the University of Nigeria, Nsukka. A UI/UX designer  and the community manager for Borderless Tech Club UNN, which is a student based community designed to foster, educate and onboarding people (students) into the web3 space. 
 
What I Do:

*Onboarding & Education ‚Äì I introduce newbies to Web3 concepts, giving them insights into the possibilities of web3 helping them navigate decentralized tools, wallets, and blockchain technology. 
https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1901027307365822784?t=12STfmu4tucQeOR1BTL29Q&s=19

*Community Engagement ‚Äì I organize interactive hangouts, and Twitter Spaces to ensure continuous learning and connection.

https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1894890610311450811?s=19
https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1887915968669630580?s=19

*Event Organization ‚Äì I amongst others were part of Coordinating the just finished Borderless 3.0 event in UNN where we had speakers shed more light on web3 and what the benefits are. Also this onboarding cuts across collaborated events too.

https://x.com/thedesign_Dr/status/1853877171573436758?s=19
https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1864571006267883744?s=19

*Strategic Growth ‚Äì I implement initiatives that drive organic community growth and long-term participation which includes various partnership with various other tech commuities with aligning visions.

https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1857369375474343994?s=19

answers.question: Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?

answers.answer:
Blockchain LAUTECH - Community Summary

Blockchain LAUTECH is a student-led blockchain community based at Ladoke Akintola University of Technology (LAUTECH). Our mission is to educate, train, and onboard students into the blockchain ecosystem, equipping them with practical skills in blockchain development, cryptocurrency trading, Web3, and decentralized applications (dApps). We achieve this through a blend of virtual and in-real-life (IRL) events, including training sessions, hackathons, and collaborative projects with established blockchain organizations.




Impact Measurement Reports

Quantitative Impact:

Membership Growth: Over 500 active members in our community, including developers, designers, and blockchain enthusiasts.

Training Sessions: Conducted 15+ workshops and webinars, reaching an average of 150 participants per session. We also co-facilitated the "Empower Ladokites" initiative by the institution where we spoke to over 4000 students about Crypto currency and Blockchain technology. We were recognized and given an award of honor by the institution for our impact.

Hackathon Participation: Engaged in 3 regional hackathons, with 5 student projects showcased and 2 projects recognized for innovative solutions.

Collaborations: Partnered with over 5 blockchain projects (including CELO) for training, mentorship, and resources.

Online Engagement: Our X handle has garnered about 500 followers with consistent interactions and community engagement.




Qualitative Impact:

Skill Development: Students report increased confidence in understanding blockchain concepts, writing smart contracts, and contributing to open-source projects.

Career Advancement: Some members have secured internships and job opportunities through our network and collaborations.

Innovation: Students have created prototype dApps addressing local issues, demonstrating their understanding of blockchain applications.

Community Building: Members express a strong sense of belonging, collaboration, and motivation to further explore blockchain technology.

Awareness and Advocacy: We have helped demystify blockchain for students, reducing misconceptions and expanding their perspective on its potential beyond cryptocurrency.




Education, community engagement, and practical experience are at the heart of what we do, and as a result, Blockchain LAUTECH is taking baby steps to nurture the next generation of blockchain innovators. We strongly believe that it is possible to do great things from a small place.

project.title: Blockchain LAUTECH
project.description:
Project Overview

Blockchain LAUTECH is a student-led blockchain community at Ladoke Akintola University of Technology (LAUTECH), dedicated to training and onboarding students into the world of blockchain technology. Our focus spans crypto education, blockchain development, web development, and participation in hackathons. We collaborate with leading projects to organize both virtual and in-real-life (IRL) events that enrich our members‚Äô knowledge and prepare them for active participation in the blockchain space.


Problem Statement

Many students have limited access to hands-on blockchain training and lack awareness of the career and innovation opportunities within the space. The technical complexity and perceived exclusivity of blockchain technology create barriers, preventing potential talents from exploring and contributing to this fast-evolving industry.


Objectives

Education and Training: Provide structured training sessions on blockchain technology, cryptocurrency, and decentralized application (dApp) development.
Community Building: Foster a supportive community of students passionate about blockchain, encouraging networking, knowledge-sharing, and collaboration.
Skill Development: Equip members with the technical skills to participate in hackathons, build on blockchain networks, and create innovative solutions.
Industry Exposure: Collaborate with established blockchain projects and organizations to provide mentorship, internship opportunities, and exposure to real-world applications.

Activities and Initiatives

1. Workshops and Webinars: Regular online and IRL training sessions on blockchain fundamentals, crypto trading, smart contract development, and Web3.

2. Hackathons: Participation in global and regional hackathons to encourage creativity and practical application of acquired skills.

3. Collaborations: Partnering with projects like Algorand Foundation to host developer workshops and provide valuable resources.

4. Knowledge Sharing: Organizing meetups, panel discussions, and AMA (Ask Me Anything) sessions to keep members updated on industry trends.

5. Mentorship and Networking: Connecting members with blockchain professionals and enthusiasts for mentorship and networking opportunities.


Impact

Skill Empowerment: Training students to develop blockchain solutions, boosting their technical expertise and employability. We have trained over 1000 students in this regard from 2020 to date.
Community Growth: Expanding the community to create a larger network of young blockchain enthusiasts across Nigeria and beyond.
Innovation: Inspiring students to explore blockchain's potential for societal impact, especially within Africa.
Ecosystem Development: Contributing to the growth of the global blockchain ecosystem by nurturing young talents.

I am Confidence Toochukwu, also known as Tmoney, a passionate Web3 community builder and project manager. As the founder of the Blockchain Revolution Conference, I led my team in hosting the first-ever Web3 conference in Northern Nigeria at Kaduna State University (KASU), successfully onboarding over 1,000 individuals into the Web3 space.
üîó https://x.com/Iam_t_money/status/1833779197963026857

My core vision is to empower individuals and businesses through decentralization, driving adoption and innovation in the blockchain ecosystem.

My Contributions to Web3 Education:

project.title: Library Protocol
project.description:
## Overview

Library Protocol is an open-source book-sharing application that enables users to bring their physical libraries on-chain, lend books, and borrow books in a borderless way. It serves as a network connecting book and library owners with book lovers, readers, and curious minds.

For centuries, books have been the cornerstone of knowledge and intellectual progress. Libraries have preserved history, empowered thinkers, and shaped civilizations. But access to books remains limited by geography, availability, and ownership.

### *What if anyone, anywhere, could borrow books seamlessly‚Äîwithout borders?*

With Library Protocol, you can:
üìö Put your personal or institutional library onchain
üîó Lend books securely using smart contracts
üìñ Borrow books from anywhere without relying on centralized platforms
üõ° Leverage a reputation-based system for responsible borrowing

*The goal? To unlock knowledge for everyone, everywhere!*

[![1500x500.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/Xq6LpcTS/1500x500.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/Vr4nhMfD) 

> LIBRARIES MUST BE BORDERLESS : A book sitting on a shelf, unread, is knowledge trapped in silence. We bring libraries onchain, beyond borders, beyond limits. A global network where books move freely, where access is no longer dictated by location or privilege.

**Why Do We Need Onchain Libraries?**

In today‚Äôs world, access to books is restricted by several barriers:
‚ùå Physical limitations ‚Äì Libraries and personal collections are confined by geography.

‚ùå High costs ‚Äì Many valuable books remain unaffordable for students, researchers, and knowledge seekers.

‚ùå Trust issues ‚Äì Traditional lending requires manual agreements with no enforcement mechanism.

‚ùå Lack of incentives ‚Äì Book owners have little reason to share their collections openly.

Library Protocol solves these issues by introducing a decentralized, global book-sharing network where ownership, lending, and borrowing are managed transparently on-chain.

[![Screenshot-2025-03-08-010256.png](https://i.postimg.cc/3J3ng1bn/Screenshot-2025-03-08-010256.png)](https://postimg.cc/BtwT3T3K) 

> OWNERSHIP AND ACCESS CAN COEXIST : Library owners should own their collections, not hoard knowledge. Readers should access books, not beg for permission. Blockchain makes this possible.

**How Library Protocol Works**

Library Protocol is designed to be open, transparent, and accessible. Here's how it works:
üìñ 1. **Create Your Onchain Library**
- Connect your wallet and create your own onchain library.
- Register books you own (metadata like Title, Author, ISBN, Cover Image stored on IPFS).
- Each book is represented as an NFT for tracking purposes.

üìö 2. **Lend Books Securely**
- List books from your library for lending.
- Set lending conditions (with or without collateral).
- Borrowers request books, and a smart contract handles agreements and collateral.

üîó 3. **Borrow Books from the Network**
- Browse available books across different libraries.
- Request to borrow, deposit collateral if required.
- Return books on time to maintain a strong reputation score.

üõ° 4. **Trust & Reputation System** 
- Every borrower and lender has an onchain reputation score.
- Timely returns improve reputation, unlocking better lending terms.

[![Screenshot-2025-03-08-014352.png](https://i.postimg.cc/qqB0Vnj0/Screenshot-2025-03-08-014352.png)](https://postimg.cc/tZc8FsKm) 

### Built for Readers, Libraries, and the Future of Knowledge
Library Protocol is built for:
üìñ **Readers & Learners** ‚Äì Anyone seeking knowledge, from casual readers to researchers.
üìö **Book Enthusiasts** ‚Äì Those who own physical books and want to share them.
üèõ **Libraries & Archives** ‚Äì Institutions aiming to digitize collections and reach a global audience in novel ways.
üë• **Communities & Educators** ‚Äì Groups looking to build decentralized knowledge-sharing hubs.
By bridging the physical and digital book world, Library Protocol creates a borderless knowledge ecosystem.

> DECENTRALIZATION EMPOWERS COMMUNITIES Libraries should not only be left to the control of centralized gatekeepers. Communities must own their knowledge. We believe in a world where people and communities build, share, and govern their own knowledge networks.

The future of libraries is on-chain. Library Protocol transforms your personal bookshelf into a gateway of global wisdom‚Äîa decentralized network that unites curious minds and delivers books to communities, you or anyone, anywhere!

metadata.title: Library Protocol
metadata.description:
## Overview

Library Protocol is an open-source book-sharing application that enables users to bring their physical libraries on-chain, lend books, and borrow books in a borderless way. It serves as a network connecting book and library owners with book lovers, readers, and curious minds.

For centuries, books have been the cornerstone of knowledge and intellectual progress. Libraries have preserved history, empowered thinkers, and shaped civilizations. But access to books remains limited by geography, availability, and ownership.

### *What if anyone, anywhere, could borrow books seamlessly‚Äîwithout borders?*

With Library Protocol, you can:
üìö Put your personal or institutional library onchain
üîó Lend books securely using smart contracts
üìñ Borrow books from anywhere without relying on centralized platforms
üõ° Leverage a reputation-based system for responsible borrowing

*The goal? To unlock knowledge for everyone, everywhere!*

[![1500x500.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/Xq6LpcTS/1500x500.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/Vr4nhMfD) 

> LIBRARIES MUST BE BORDERLESS : A book sitting on a shelf, unread, is knowledge trapped in silence. We bring libraries onchain, beyond borders, beyond limits. A global network where books move freely, where access is no longer dictated by location or privilege.

**Why Do We Need Onchain Libraries?**

In today‚Äôs world, access to books is restricted by several barriers:
‚ùå Physical limitations ‚Äì Libraries and personal collections are confined by geography.

‚ùå High costs ‚Äì Many valuable books remain unaffordable for students, researchers, and knowledge seekers.

‚ùå Trust issues ‚Äì Traditional lending requires manual agreements with no enforcement mechanism.

‚ùå Lack of incentives ‚Äì Book owners have little reason to share their collections openly.

Library Protocol solves these issues by introducing a decentralized, global book-sharing network where ownership, lending, and borrowing are managed transparently on-chain.

[![Screenshot-2025-03-08-010256.png](https://i.postimg.cc/3J3ng1bn/Screenshot-2025-03-08-010256.png)](https://postimg.cc/BtwT3T3K) 

> OWNERSHIP AND ACCESS CAN COEXIST : Library owners should own their collections, not hoard knowledge. Readers should access books, not beg for permission. Blockchain makes this possible.

**How Library Protocol Works**

Library Protocol is designed to be open, transparent, and accessible. Here's how it works:
üìñ 1. **Create Your Onchain Library**
- Connect your wallet and create your own onchain library.
- Register books you own (metadata like Title, Author, ISBN, Cover Image stored on IPFS).
- Each book is represented as an NFT for tracking purposes.

üìö 2. **Lend Books Securely**
- List books from your library for lending.
- Set lending conditions (with or without collateral).
- Borrowers request books, and a smart contract handles agreements and collateral.

üîó 3. **Borrow Books from the Network**
- Browse available books across different libraries.
- Request to borrow, deposit collateral if required.
- Return books on time to maintain a strong reputation score.

üõ° 4. **Trust & Reputation System** 
- Every borrower and lender has an onchain reputation score.
- Timely returns improve reputation, unlocking better lending terms.

[![Screenshot-2025-03-08-014352.png](https://i.postimg.cc/qqB0Vnj0/Screenshot-2025-03-08-014352.png)](https://postimg.cc/tZc8FsKm) 

### Built for Readers, Libraries, and the Future of Knowledge
Library Protocol is built for:
üìñ **Readers & Learners** ‚Äì Anyone seeking knowledge, from casual readers to researchers.
üìö **Book Enthusiasts** ‚Äì Those who own physical books and want to share them.
üèõ **Libraries & Archives** ‚Äì Institutions aiming to digitize collections and reach a global audience in novel ways.
üë• **Communities & Educators** ‚Äì Groups looking to build decentralized knowledge-sharing hubs.
By bridging the physical and digital book world, Library Protocol creates a borderless knowledge ecosystem.

> DECENTRALIZATION EMPOWERS COMMUNITIES Libraries should not only be left to the control of centralized gatekeepers. Communities must own their knowledge. We believe in a world where people and communities build, share, and govern their own knowledge networks.

The future of libraries is on-chain. Library Protocol transforms your personal bookshelf into a gateway of global wisdom‚Äîa decentralized network that unites curious minds and delivers books to communities, you or anyone, anywhere!

project.title: Borderless
project.description:
Borderless is a non-for-profit tech arm of Crypto Smart that aims to train at least 100 African tech developers each year to build Web2 and Web3 products. We do this by establishing physical hubs, hosting events, providing training, offering mentorship, and launching tech projects.

Physical hubs: B<>rder/ess will have physical hubs in several African countries that provide a space for developers to learn, collaborate, and network.

The first was opened in November 2022 in Port-Harcourt Nigeria and the next will be opened at the University Of Port-Harcourt Nigeria.

Events: B<>rder/ess hosts a variety of events, such as hackathons, meetups, and conferences. These events provide developers with opportunities to learn new skills, meet new people, and share their work, the last event was held in November 2022 in Port-Harcourt Nigeria. See the highlights here https://borderless.cryptosmartnow.io/event

Training: B<>rder/ess offers a variety of training programs, both online and in person. These programs cover a wide range of topics, including web development, blockchain development, and data science.

Mentorship: B<>rder/ess pairs developers with experienced mentors. These mentors provide guidance and support to help developers reach their full potential.

project.title: Byte Onchain News
project.description:
# Project Description:

ByteOnchain News is a premier Web3 educational media platform dedicated to empowering individuals by connecting them to blockchain, decentralized technologies, and public goods opportunities.

Through insightful journalism, expert analysis, and hands-on educational resources, we bridge the gap between industry innovations and real-world applications, fostering a more inclusive Web3 ecosystem.

We equip developers, entrepreneurs, and enthusiasts with actionable insights, career-building resources, and industry connections, ensuring they can actively participate in and benefit from the evolving Web3 landscape.

Our platform collaborates with leading Web3 organizations, decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), and blockchain foundations to facilitate funding, mentorship, and skill development programs, ensuring equitable access to Web3 Public Goods.

ByteOnchain News delivers thought leadership through research-driven articles, feature stories, and career-focused content.

Our deep dives into emerging trends, funding mechanisms, and decentralized governance equip our audience to navigate the Web3 space confidently.

Our platform covers a diverse range of topics, from emerging funding models to career pathways in Web3. 

# Some of our key content includes:

* Deep Dive: A Break Down of Streaming Quadratic Funding (SQF) ‚Äì Understanding new funding mechanisms for decentralized projects.
https://byteonchain.news/deep-dive-a-break-down-of-streaming-quadratic-funding-sqf/

* Borderless Dev Hub Academy is Building Web3 Careers Across Africa ‚Äì How Borderless Dev Hub‚Äôs blockchain education is transforming the job market.
https://byteonchain.news/borderless-dev-hub-academy-is-building-web3-careers-across-africa/

* Skynet √ó Tria Collaboration: Unlocking the Potential Of AI On Arbitrum ‚Äì Exploring AI and blockchain integration.
https://byteonchain.news/skynet/

* Taking Notes on Web3 in Africa: Increasing Public Goods Awareness ‚Äì How Blockchain has evolved in the minds of Africans, creating a shift in investment path.
https://byteonchain.news/taking-notes-on-web3-in-africa-increasing-public-goods-awareness/

*Beyond Bitcoin: Kavita Gupta‚Äôs optimism on Ethereum ‚Äì Insights from industry leaders on the future of Ethereum.
https://byteonchain.news/beyond-bitcoin-kavita-guptas-optimism-on-ethereum/

*Ownership vs. Public Storage: Can Blockchain Solve Ownership Autonomy? ‚Äì Examining decentralized storage and ownership rights.
https://byteonchain.news/ownership-vs-public-storage-can-blockchain-solve-ownership-autonomy/

Decentracode is a transformative initiative designed to onboard African developers into the web3 ecosystem, equipping them with the skills, tools, and resources needed to build decentralized applications (dApps) that address Africa‚Äôs unique challenges. Through a combination of residency programs, online courses, and community-driven collaboration, Decentracode is fostering innovation, financial inclusion, and technological advancement across the continent.

Key Achievements and Impact:
First Builder residency program from february to May this year: 2025. 

40 students registered for the hybrid program and 19 are currently still on with 8 onsite. (Accomodation and internet sorted by decentracode.) The list of those that registered: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dY5JNdxakEKIxiJ7rjxzYJ5HLqHnjg_EkpVCeFevfOs/edit?gid=892955439#gid=892955439

Up until: 100+ smartcontracts deployed on testnets. Below are some of the student wallets that are deploying in the cohort. The list to some of the addresses created by the students and their activities on sepolia testnet:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IN9oh3s-kFou68rmmVdn3o3o7GbVXXtTNUroGYKQjjU/edit?gid=648213356#gid=648213356

We are also pushing beyond the boundaries of projects builds and they can be found listed in the decentracode discord where the founder and other students interested in pushing them further can contribute to them. Link: https://discord.gg/ERxW9aMy.   in the openstats chanel under members charts.

Overview:
Decentracode is a groundbreaking initiative dedicated to onboarding African web3 builders into the blockchain ecosystem. Through a combination of residency and online programs, Decentracode empowers developers to learn, collaborate, and build decentralized applications (dApps) that solve real-world problems across Africa. By leveraging blockchain technology, Decentracode fosters innovation, financial inclusion, and technological advancement on the continent while creating a global impact.

Mission:
To empower African developers with the skills, tools, and resources needed to thrive in the web3 space, enabling them to build decentralized solutions that address Africa‚Äôs unique challenges and opportunities.

project.title: UNIZIK BLOCKCHAIN LAB (UBL)
project.description:
1. INTRODUCTION

Unizik Blockchain Lab (UBL) is a Web3-focused community at Nnamdi Azikiwe University, Awka, dedicated to educating students, fostering industry connections, and driving blockchain adoption for free. We aim to empower students with the knowledge and skills needed to navigate the evolving blockchain and Web3 space while bridging the gap between companies and young talents. Since our inception, we have hosted numerous educational sessions, bootcamps, and hackathons, partnered with leading Web3 brands, and facilitated career opportunities for students in the blockchain industry.

2. OBJECTIVES

Educate Students on blockchain, DeFi, tech, and Web3 technologies.

Create Career Opportunities by connecting students with blockchain/Web3 companies.

Enhance Adoption of blockchain through hands-on training, hackathons, and conferences.

Build a Sustainable Tech Community by fostering long-term partnerships and mentorship programs.

3. KEY ACHIEVEMENTS

Education & Training
‚úÖ Hosted multiple classes focused on Blockchain, Web3, and DeFi.

 ‚úÖ Organized a 2-week trading bootcamp to equip students with crypto trading skills.

 ‚úÖ Conducted a 2-week DeFi bootcamp, which had 234 registrations and 66 successful graduates.

 ‚úÖ Launched an 8-week Web2 Developers Bootcamp with 118 registrations, preparing students for the Web3 Developer Bootcamp.

Profile link: https://x.com/blockchainNAU?t=0hoZ-A8wtMjdqcT-rjz_NQ&s=09

Our Telegram group link(where we hold most of our classes): https://t.me/blockchainNAU

‚úÖ Hosted two physical blockchain conferences:
First Conference: Over 1000 registrations and 400+ attendees.
Second Conference: Over 800 registrations and 500+ attendees.

 Organized a Hackathon, sponsored by ICP, to encourage hands-on Web3 project development.

Partnerships & Collaborations
‚úÖ Established strong brand partnerships, including:
Yellowcard, ICP, SaveFi, ICT Anambra, Celo, Memecore.org, GIDA, Rabble, Soll, IpayBTC, TRX.

 ‚úÖ Built community partnerships with leading blockchain organizations, including:
Borderless, Anambra Techie, Alpha Blocks, CBC, Borderless Unizik, Anambra Web3 Conference, Apex Hub, GIG Unizik, Bitcoin Anambra, Blockchain Revolution Conference, Teens Girls in Blockchain, Flend, Zion Tech Hub, Women in DeFi.
Community Building

‚úÖ Established UBL Academy, a physical weekend meetup for blockchain and web3 learning and networking.

4. IMPACT & FUTURE PLANS

Graduate at least 200+ students annually with blockchain and Web3 skills.

Expand our bootcamp programs to include blockchain security, smart contract auditing, and decentralized applications (DApps).

Scale our hackathons to attract global blockchain innovators.

Enhance partnerships with more Web3 companies for internship and job placement opportunities.

Launch a research and innovation center focused on solving real-world problems with blockchain technology.

5. CONCLUSION

Unizik Blockchain Lab (UBL) is committed to empowering students with blockchain knowledge, connecting them to industry leaders, and fostering a thriving Web3 ecosystem on campus. Through strategic partnerships, hands-on training, and real-world applications, we aim to position Nnamdi Azikiwe University as a hub for blockchain innovation in Africa.
We look forward to collaborating with more organizations and individuals to scale our impact and build the future of decentralized technology.

metadata.title: UNIZIK BLOCKCHAIN LAB (UBL)
metadata.description:
1. INTRODUCTION

Unizik Blockchain Lab (UBL) is a Web3-focused community at Nnamdi Azikiwe University, Awka, dedicated to educating students, fostering industry connections, and driving blockchain adoption for free. We aim to empower students with the knowledge and skills needed to navigate the evolving blockchain and Web3 space while bridging the gap between companies and young talents. Since our inception, we have hosted numerous educational sessions, bootcamps, and hackathons, partnered with leading Web3 brands, and facilitated career opportunities for students in the blockchain industry.

2. OBJECTIVES

Educate Students on blockchain, DeFi, tech, and Web3 technologies.

Create Career Opportunities by connecting students with blockchain/Web3 companies.

Enhance Adoption of blockchain through hands-on training, hackathons, and conferences.

Build a Sustainable Tech Community by fostering long-term partnerships and mentorship programs.

3. KEY ACHIEVEMENTS

Education & Training
‚úÖ Hosted multiple classes focused on Blockchain, Web3, and DeFi.

 ‚úÖ Organized a 2-week trading bootcamp to equip students with crypto trading skills.

 ‚úÖ Conducted a 2-week DeFi bootcamp, which had 234 registrations and 66 successful graduates.

 ‚úÖ Launched an 8-week Web2 Developers Bootcamp with 118 registrations, preparing students for the Web3 Developer Bootcamp.
