project.title: Borderless Animators Connect
project.description:
My name is King David (aka The Saint Cradle), and my project involves getting people involved in animation for web3 implementation. I want to train them to harness the power of animation, both 2d and 3d, to be able to create captivating and stunning visuals that only they could imagine. Turning them into the creatives they are. This also helps us plan with hosting our very own game-fi platform, which should be able to launch within 7 months to 1 year if the due diligence is done. Animations have always been an ideal way of storytelling, and I want more members to be able to share their unique stories in a way only they can. Plus, I will also introduce them to the jobs available for animators in the web3 space, which is quite a lot given how few we are currently‚Ä¶
I have created informative flyers for the tech club concerning DAO events that have been held on my campus. I have also created custom UI animations that have been used by some of my colleagues to add uniqueness to their work, a sort of easter egg if you will‚Ä¶

I have created informative flyers for the tech club concerning DAO events that have been held on my campus. I have also created custom UI animations that have been used by some of my colleagues to add uniqueness to their work, a sort of easter egg if you will‚Ä¶

project.title: Maze of Africa
project.description:
I'm Amazement, a creative writer & content creator who is passionate about using storytelling in written materials like LinkedIn articles and X threads to effectively explain web3 fundamentals and simplify difficult concepts for the purpose of education and, eventually, onboarding people into the web3 space, especially non-technical creatives.

In addition to using my X profile to promote web3 education, events, and initiatives, I am a member of the Borderless community and have supported the web3 ecosystem through the content team by producing written content such as X tweets, LinkedIn articles, promotional material captions, and hosted X spaces.

Additionally, I'm a member of the MGSWEB3 web3 community, which aims to onboard creatives (writers, content producers, graphic designers, researchers, and marketers) into the non-technical web3 domains by guiding them through specialized tracks and assigning them to projects that will help them develop a portfolio.

I contributed with creating a video that was towards awareness for the 3rd cohort:

https://www.instagram.com/reel/DH3zDC4sNTm/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igsh=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==

project.title: Ginakev Digital Academy (GIDA)
project.description:
# ABOUT GIDA

Ginakev Digital Academy (GIDA) is an EduTech Academy committed to driving tech, digital literacy and Web3/blockchain adoption in Africa.

Since our inception in 2020, **we have impacted over 10,000 individuals for FREE** with web3 knowledge via both virtual and IRL sessions aimed at raising blockchain experts, Web3 users and seasoned builders.


‚û§ We've trained 200+ persons with the skill of Blockchain development through our [Web3 developer bootcamps](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialGIDA/playlists) , and most of them are now gainfully employed in the ecosystem.

‚û§ We've collaborated and partnered with [Starknet Foundation](https://x.com/starknetfndn/status/1894684962776842369?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [Arbitrum](https://x.com/official_gida/status/1776147099823874171?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg),  [Avalanche](https://x.com/official_gida/status/1828119309010292850?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg), [Web3bridge](https://x.com/web3lagoscon/status/1820159140309688431?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg) and lots of top projects in the ecosystem on various initiatives, particularly towards training devs for FREE. 



‚û§ We have an active Web3 developer community of people we've trained (both Solidity & Rust), Traders community, DEFI community and other sub-communities relevant in web3 (We have a diversity of skillsets we teach).

‚û§ We have partnerships with various communities and associations in most Universities, thus helping build our penetration across Nigeria and Africa.


# THE GIDA METHODOLOGY


‚û§ We are on a drive to spread adoption through Proper Education.

‚û§ We organize Physical meetups & [IRL blockchain-focused events](https://x.com/official_gida/status/1882352437966913761?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg) aimed at educating, engaging and empowering blockchain enthusiasts, geared towards raising the next generation of talents.

‚û§ All our bootcamps, cohorts and programs at GIDA [comes with a certificate](https://x.com/official_gida/status/1853340691465752925?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9mIg) upon completion.


‚û§ We provide training, offer mentorship, and get people well positioned to launch tech projects.



> Our primary goal is to ensure Financial inclusion for all (FIFA).


# SOME OF OUR RECENT PROGRAMS

- GIDA Web3 Blockchain developer bootcamp 1.0 (8 Weeks in collaboration with Starknet) - https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMgu40BCFGzo7PsXI1ua4QoUrqNZV3yVI&si=b-7QpoSVv9WoGgdA

- "Back to Crypto" Web3 FREE advanced Onboarding bootcamp - https://twitter.com/Official_GIDA/status/1734257161008492949?t=46J-AzJX_M6EdomQnWQUzQ&s=19

- GIDA ChainUP Roadshow/IRL onboarding event in Kaduna State - https://x.com/Official_GIDA/status/1884917589819740659?t=20ueQu45wcg5D7NVa5Lz8A&s=19

- GIDA ChainUP Roadshow/IRL onboarding event in Ibadan City - https://x.com/official_gida/status/1885418330225250608?s=46&t=zaDhrGydSI43aMot8l9m

- GIDA ChainUP Roadshow/IRL onboarding event in Benin City - https://x.com/Official_GIDA/status/1887405088840261981?t=LOFtG5nuo8vzc85pG3LbMQ&s=19

- GIDA ChainUP Roadshow/IRL onboarding event in Anambra State - https://x.com/Official_GIDA/status/1889572118616285599?t=XAzdbAWP-ZM0B-TqGxDNGQ&s=19

project.title: w3zetech
project.description:
Who are wee ???
W3Zetech is a university-based blockchain community dedicated to technical education, hands-on development, and industry exposures. Since our inception in September 2023, we have grown from three passionate founders to a thriving community of 100+ active members, collaborating with top blockchain protocols and organizations to bring cutting-edge Web3 knowledge and opportunities to students.

We've hosted 10+ large-scale events, including bootcamps, hackathons, technical workshops, and mentorship sessions‚Äîempowering students to build real blockchain solutions and launch careers in Web3.

Beyond education, we are building blockchain products and shaping a community-led future by transitioning W3Zetech into a DAO, where members will have a direct say in the direction of the organization.

Our Impact So Far
üîπ RiseIn Bootcamp: Over 500 registrants, 170+ graduates, hands-on blockchain training.
üîπ World Metaverse Council Bootcamps: Training students on immersive Web3 technologies.
üîπ 36-Hour Physical Hackathon with Hackquest: A non-stop, all-night event with 100+ participants and 30 projects pitched.

üîπ Technical Workshops with:
Cartesi (Rollups & Smart Contract Execution)
Web3.js (Ethereum Development)
The Graph (Decentralized Indexing)
Celo (Mobile-First Blockchain)
Solana (High-Performance Blockchain)
NEAR Protocol (Sharded Blockchain Solutions)

üîπ Ideathons with:
Arbitrum (2 ideathons)
Internet Computer (ICP) (1 ideathon)

üîπEvents with:
Nodo (Tether and Stable coins)


üîπ Career Mentorship with:
Gochapaa
Nethermind rep
Notable industry leaders & mentors 

üîπ In-Person Trainings : Hands-on blockchain development and ecosystem deep dives.
üîπPartnerships with Communities like : Web3Clubs, MetaMeta Club, Astro Armadilos, Hackquest,RiseIn,LedgerLady,GDG ,and several local developer communities.

This strong foundation of education, collaboration, and real-world development is what makes W3Zetech unique.

Our Vision: From Community to DAO

We are transitioning W3Zetech into a fully decentralized organization (DAO) where every member has a direct say in governance, funding, and initiatives.

üîπ Phase 1: Education & Community Growth ‚Äì Scaling workshops, hackathons, and blockchain career programs.
üîπ Phase 2: Product Development ‚Äì Building blockchain-based learning platforms, tools, and open-source projects.
üîπ Phase 3: DAO Transition ‚Äì Implementing on-chain voting and decentralized governance to empower the community.

This ensures that every student and contributor plays an active role in shaping the future of W3Zetech.

To Summarise :
W3Zetech is more than just a student club it‚Äôs a movement to empower the next generation of blockchain pioneers. We are a dynamic, fast-growing community that believes in learning by doing, collaborating with global blockchain leaders, and building real-world Web3 solutions.

From technical education to hands-on development and decentralized governance, we are shaping an ecosystem where students don‚Äôt just learn about blockchain they actively build its future.

Our vision is clear: a fully decentralized, community-driven network where every member has a voice, every idea has the potential to grow, and every contribution makes a real impact.

Whether you're a student eager to break into Web3, a developer looking for a challenge, or an organization seeking to collaborate, W3Zetech welcomes you.

Join us in this journey. Together, we are building the future of Web3

project.title: Rappy
project.description:
Rappy is a lightning-fast CLI tool built to revolutionize the way developers scaffold Web3 projects. By seamlessly integrating a Next.js frontend with the choice of Foundry or Hardhat for smart contract development, Rappy eliminates the complexity and time-consuming setup typically associated with starting a new Web3 project. Its mission is to empower developers to focus on what truly matters‚Äîbuilding and innovating‚Äîwhile it handles the heavy lifting of configuration.

With Rappy, developers can set up a fully functional Web3 project in minutes, complete with a modern frontend, pre-configured smart contract environments, and built-in tools for testing, formatting, and development scripts. By simplifying the tedious and often frustrating setup process, Rappy accelerates the development lifecycle, enabling faster iteration and deployment of Web3 applications.

Rappy‚Äôs impact goes beyond just saving time‚Äîit lowers the barrier to entry for new developers and enhances productivity for experienced ones. By addressing the pain points of project setup, Rappy fosters innovation and empowers developers to create impactful, cutting-edge Web3 applications that drive the ecosystem forward. Whether you're building a decentralized app, a DeFi protocol, or an NFT platform, Rappy is your go-to tool for a seamless and efficient development experience.

Summary of My Work & Impact in Blockchain & Open-Source Development

As a passionate Blockchain Frontend Developer, I specialize in building user-centric decentralized applications (dApps) using modern web technologies and blockchain tools. My experience spans multiple ETHGlobal hackathons, where I have developed and refined innovative Web3 solutions, often securing top prizes. Additionally, I have contributed to Eliza OS, an open-source project focused on advancing blockchain infrastructure.

‚∏ª

Key Contributions & Achievements

Hackathon Projects & Recognitions
	‚Ä¢	ETHGlobal Autonomous Worlds Hackathon ‚Äì OPEN AR
	‚Ä¢	Built a spatial Web3 platform enabling communities to create immersive sandbox experiences.
	‚Ä¢	Proof of Participation: POAP Token
	‚Ä¢	ETHGlobal Space Warp Hackathon ‚Äì Milky-Wei
	‚Ä¢	Developed a decentralized game development assets marketplace for indie devs.
	‚Ä¢	Winner of Push Protocol ‚Äì Best Use
	‚Ä¢	Proof of Participation: POAP Token
	‚Ä¢	ETH Safari Hackathon ‚Äì Tembo
	‚Ä¢	Built a Web3 solution for charities to enhance transparency and reduce administrative costs.
	‚Ä¢	Coinbase Prize Pool Winner
	‚Ä¢	Proof of Participation: POAP
	‚Ä¢	ETHOnline Hackathon ‚Äì JPEGX
	‚Ä¢	Created a decentralized NFT options protocol using a pool design for liquidity and pricing.
	‚Ä¢	Winner of Superfluid ‚Äì Best DeFi Hack
	‚Ä¢	Winner of Tellor ‚Äì Best Use
	‚Ä¢	Proof of Participation: POAP Token
	‚Ä¢	ETHGlobal Hack FS Hackathon ‚Äì Plusheaven.ETH
	‚Ä¢	Developed a transparent and secure Web3 casino game.
	‚Ä¢	Winner of Valist Prize Pool
	‚Ä¢	Proof of Participation: POAP Token

‚∏ª

Blockchain & Open-Source Contributions
	‚Ä¢	Frontend Development for Web3: Built dApps with React, Next.js, and TypeScript, integrating blockchain features using Solidity, Ethers.js, and Hardhat.
	‚Ä¢	Smart Contract Integration: Deployed and tested smart contracts using Remix, Truffle, and Hardhat on Ethereum and EVM-compatible chains.
	‚Ä¢	Eliza OS Open Source Contribution: Contributed to Eliza OS, helping to improve blockchain infrastructure and optimize Web3 tooling.
	‚Ä¢	Web3 Community Engagement: Actively participate in blockchain discussions, mentor aspiring developers, and advocate for decentralized technologies.

‚∏ª

Impact Measurement Report

Quantitative Impact:
	‚Ä¢	5+ Hackathons Won across ETHGlobal and ETHSafari.
	‚Ä¢	1000+ Developers & Builders reached through hackathons, workshops, and blockchain events.

Qualitative Impact:

answers.answer:
We have successfully organized a series of blockchain education and open-source software (OSS) development activities, aligning with the round funding focus on blockchain adoption, community engagement, and enterprise uptake.

Blockchain Education & Adoption Initiatives
	‚Ä¢	We have hosted panel discussions and workshops featuring experts to explore real-world applications of ‚ÄúAptos‚Äù, ‚ÄúEthereum‚Äù, and ‚ÄúSolana‚Äù, discussing scalability, security, and enterprise adoption.
	‚Ä¢	We have conducted hands-on hackathons where students developed decentralized applications (dApps) utilizing ‚ÄúAptos‚Äù, ‚ÄúPolygon‚Äù, and ‚ÄúCosmos‚Äù, fostering innovation in smart contract development.
	‚Ä¢	We have facilitated collaborations with blockchain enterprises, providing students with mentorship opportunities in technologies such as ‚ÄúHyperledger Fabric‚Äù and ‚ÄúSubstrate‚Äù, supporting enterprise-level blockchain solutions.

Community Engagement & Student Involvement
	‚Ä¢	We have expanded university engagement through blockchain meetups, including a session at the University of Nairobi, where students explored ‚ÄúBitcoin Lightning Network‚Äù for micropayments and decentralized finance.
	‚Ä¢	We have hosted live discussions on ‚ÄúTwitter Spaces‚Äù, engaging students in conversations about Kenyan tech communities and blockchain career pathways.
	‚Ä¢	We have established student-led blockchain clubs where members engaged in peer learning and development projects on ‚ÄúEthereum‚Äù and ‚ÄúAptos‚Äù.

Open Source Software (OSS) Development & DevOps Training
	‚Ä¢	We have conducted a full-day workshop on ‚ÄúGitHub Actions‚Äù, focusing on continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) automation for open-source blockchain projects.
	‚Ä¢	We have trained participants on ‚ÄúMongoDB Atlas‚Äù, enabling them to set up and manage decentralized database solutions for blockchain applications.
	‚Ä¢	We have provided hands-on sessions with ‚ÄúDocker‚Äù and ‚ÄúKubernetes‚Äù, equipping developers with the skills necessary for blockchain infrastructure deployment and containerized environments.
	‚Ä¢	We have introduced ‚ÄúGraphQL‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Graph Protocol‚Äù, guiding students on indexing and querying blockchain data efficiently.
	‚Ä¢	We have facilitated coding workshops in ‚ÄúRust‚Äù and ‚ÄúMove‚Äù, the latter being instrumental in the development of secure smart contracts on ‚ÄúAptos‚Äù.

Impact & Future Directions

Through these initiatives, we have enhanced blockchain adoption, fostered open-source contributions, and empowered students with technical expertise in cutting-edge blockchain protocols. Future plans include expanding training programs, launching blockchain certification pathways, and strengthening enterprise partnerships to drive further innovation in decentralized technologies.

project.title: UoN Coding Club
project.description:
At UoN Coding Club, we are committed to equipping students with the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in the world of Web3, blockchain, and emerging technologies. Our goal is to bridge the gap between traditional education and the fast-evolving tech landscape by fostering hands-on learning, innovation, and career development.

What We Do
üîπ Web3 & Blockchain Education ‚Äì Hosting bootcamps and workshops to introduce students to blockchain, smart contracts, and decentralized applications.
üîπ Hackathons & Open-Source Innovation ‚Äì Organizing hackathons that encourage students to build and contribute to real-world Web3 solutions.
üîπ Career Grooming & Networking ‚Äì Facilitating mentorship sessions, career talks, and networking opportunities with Web3 professionals and industry leaders.
üîπ Data Science & Web Development ‚Äì Providing training on smart contract development, data analytics, and AI applications in blockchain.

Our Impact
‚úÖ Onboarded students into blockchain and Web3 technologies.
‚úÖ Conducted  bootcamps and hackathons, fostering innovation and collaboration.
‚úÖ Partnered with industry experts to create career development opportunities.
‚úÖ Supported student developers in launching open-source Web3 projects.

By securing the Web3 for Universities grant, we aim to expand our initiatives, enhance educational resources, and provide more opportunities for students at the University of Nairobi to excel in Web3 and blockchain innovation.

answers.answer:
1. Simplifying Web3 Concepts

* In this creative and educational video, I broke down STAKING for Web2 users and Web3 newbies using an analogy they could easily relate to and understand. This post was shared across X, Instagram, and TikTok to educate a vast and dynamic audience.

Watch here: https://www.instagram.com/reel/DFCXw9FIGxS/?igsh=MWFmZGkycDJpN2kyMw==


      2. Hosting & Coordinating Web3 Education Sessions

Utilizing the Borderless Dev Twitter, I coordinated a series of five X Spaces aimed at onboarding new users into Web3. Topics included:

* Transitioning into Tech and Transferable Skills

* What is Tech and How to Get Started

* Blockchain Technology and Cryptocurrency

* Navigating Blockchain Technology as a Newbie

# Highlights from these spaces:
https://x.com/BorderlessDev/status/1731007486964937155

# Speaker Session:
 Doubling as a speaker, I shared insights on "Navigating Blockchain Technology as a Newbie"
Speaker Highlights: https://x.com/BorderlessDev/status/1731016611719418026 

      3. She Builds on Near: A Women-Focused Blockchain Conference

Co-organized and hosted a 3-day ladies‚Äô blockchain conference titled 'She Builds on Near', which included:

* Marketing and publicity to drive registrations.


* Emails and SMS reminders to participants.


* Coordination of facilitators, while also serving as a facilitator myself..

The goal was to onboard women into Web3 and introduce them to building on-chain.

Watch here: https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMB6ccrwB/

Watch here: https://youtu.be/Lp9xEao-QrY?si=EjU3cuXX676grFlz

* Co-headed the Borderless 2.0 Campus Tour, reaching eight universities to onboard students and invite them to the Borderless 2.0 event.

* A major highlight was a collaboration with Joint Christian Campus Fellowship UNIPORT, which resulted in many of their members attending Borderless 2.0.

project.title: Tina Truth
project.description:
# We All Have to Keep Up!

It‚Äôs been 17 years since the Bitcoin white paper was released, yet many have not kept up with the times. The very thought of a third web still baffles their minds.

Mass adoption is what we all look forward to, but let‚Äôs be realistic‚Äîit isn‚Äôt a magical one-day event.

Mass adoption happens when someone, somewhere, takes action to help another person come on-chain.

That "action" is what I take with content creation.


> My Impact in Web3 Onboarding & Education

As a Web3 creative within the Borderless ecosystem, and Director of the Borderless Tech Clubs, I have coordinated and contributed to several Web3 onboarding initiatives that have successfully brought new users on-chain over the past years. My educational contents span across multiple social media platforms, ensuring a diverse and broad audience benefits from Web3 knowledge.

#### Proof of Work

      1. Simplifying Web3 Concepts

* In this creative and educational video, I broke down STAKING for Web2 users and Web3 newbies using an analogy they could easily relate to and understand. This post was shared across X, Instagram, and TikTok to educate a vast and dynamic audience.

Watch here: https://www.instagram.com/reel/DFCXw9FIGxS/?igsh=MWFmZGkycDJpN2kyMw==


      2. Hosting & Coordinating Web3 Education Sessions

Utilizing the Borderless Dev Twitter, I coordinated a series of five X Spaces aimed at onboarding new users into Web3. Topics included:

* Transitioning into Tech and Transferable Skills

* What is Tech and How to Get Started

* Blockchain Technology and Cryptocurrency

* Navigating Blockchain Technology as a Newbie

# Highlights from these spaces:
https://x.com/BorderlessDev/status/1731007486964937155

# Speaker Session:
 Doubling as a speaker, I shared insights on "Navigating Blockchain Technology as a Newbie"
Speaker Highlights: https://x.com/BorderlessDev/status/1731016611719418026 

      3. She Builds on Near: A Women-Focused Blockchain Conference

Co-organized and hosted a 3-day ladies‚Äô blockchain conference titled 'She Builds on Near', which included:

* Marketing and publicity to drive registrations.


* Emails and SMS reminders to participants.


* Coordination of facilitators, while also serving as a facilitator myself..

The goal was to onboard women into Web3 and introduce them to building on-chain.

# Event post: https://x.com/BorderlessDev/status/1791304972245795135

# Event Report and Metrics: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OnXTVaMmGQy5VgD4GNe-9SMaAtEItZm3vRlyO8HrSGw/edit?usp=sharing

# Promotional Video: 
Created an engaging video to drive registrations for She Builds on Near and the 3-month Cipher session: Build on Near.

Watch here:  https://x.com/_tinatruth/status/1793403635692687860 

       4. Borderless 3.0 Onboarding & Promotional Campaign

* Created a video ad to boost awareness for Borderless 3.0, inviting newbies into the space through a poetic and engaging narrative.

Watch here: https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMB6ccrwB/ 

* Borderless Impact Report: Collaborated with a videographer to craft an impact report highlighting the victories of the past year while promoting Borderless 3.0. The report blended news and poetry for a compelling storytelling experience.

Watch here: https://youtu.be/Lp9xEao-QrY?si=EjU3cuXX676grFlz 

       5.  Borderless 2.0 & University Campus Tour

* Co-headed the Borderless 2.0 Campus Tour, reaching eight universities to onboard students and invite them to the Borderless 2.0 event.

* A major highlight was a collaboration with Joint Christian Campus Fellowship UNIPORT, which resulted in many of their members attending Borderless 2.0.

Read more: https://x.com/cryptosmartnow/status/1714947226995159088 


In my role as Director of Borderless Tech Clubs,  working through the different tech leads, I have greatly contributed to web3 adoption across multiple universities in Nigeria while impacting many through web 3 content creation

By funding this initiative, you‚Äôll be helping drive real world web3 adoption and helping the people in my world keep up.

Co-organized and hosted a 3-day ladies‚Äô blockchain conference titled 'She Builds on Near', which included:

* Marketing and publicity to drive registrations.


* Emails and SMS reminders to participants.


* Coordination of facilitators, while also serving as a facilitator myself..

The goal was to onboard women into Web3 and introduce them to building on-chain.

# Event post: https://x.com/BorderlessDev/status/1791304972245795135

# Event Report and Metrics: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OnXTVaMmGQy5VgD4GNe-9SMaAtEItZm3vRlyO8HrSGw/edit?usp=sharing

# Promotional Video: 
Created an engaging video to drive registrations for She Builds on Near and the 3-month Cipher session: Build on Near.

Watch here:  https://x.com/_tinatruth/status/1793403635692687860 

       4. Borderless 3.0 Onboarding & Promotional Campaign

* Created a video ad to boost awareness for Borderless 3.0, inviting newbies into the space through a poetic and engaging narrative.

Watch here: https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMB6ccrwB/ 

* Borderless Impact Report: Collaborated with a videographer to craft an impact report highlighting the victories of the past year while promoting Borderless 3.0. The report blended news and poetry for a compelling storytelling experience.

Watch here: https://youtu.be/Lp9xEao-QrY?si=EjU3cuXX676grFlz 

       5.  Borderless 2.0 & University Campus Tour

* Co-headed the Borderless 2.0 Campus Tour, reaching eight universities to onboard students and invite them to the Borderless 2.0 event.

* A major highlight was a collaboration with Joint Christian Campus Fellowship UNIPORT, which resulted in many of their members attending Borderless 2.0.

Read more: https://x.com/cryptosmartnow/status/1714947226995159088 


In my role as Director of Borderless Tech Clubs,  working through the different tech leads, I have greatly contributed to web3 adoption across multiple universities in Nigeria while impacting many through web 3 content creation

By funding this initiative, you‚Äôll be helping drive real world web3 adoption and helping the people in my world keep up.

answers.answer:
### **Project Summary: BetaUI ‚Äì A Modular & Sleek UI Library**  

**BetaUI** is a cutting-edge UI library designed to streamline frontend development by providing **pre-built, customizable components** for both **Web2** and **Web3** applications. It allows developers to focus on functionality rather than UI design, enhancing efficiency and accelerating project deployment.  

---

### **Key Features & Components**  

#### **üåê Web3 Components**  
BetaUI simplifies blockchain-based UI development with ready-to-use components:  
- **NFT Cards** ‚Äì Displays NFTs in a visually appealing format.  
- **Wallet Connection Modal** ‚Äì Provides a seamless way to connect crypto wallets.  
- **Successful Transaction Modal** ‚Äì Notifies users of blockchain transactions in real time.  
- **Token Swap Interface** ‚Äì Simplifies the token-swapping process in dApps.  

#### **üíª Web2 Components**  
For traditional web applications, BetaUI offers essential UI elements:  
- **Customizable Toast Alerts** ‚Äì Enhances user experience with intuitive notifications.  
- **Modular UI Elements** ‚Äì Speeds up frontend development with reusable components.  

---

### **üìä Impact Measurement**  

#### **‚úÖ Quantitative Impact**  
- **800+ Downloads** ‚Äì Reflecting its growing adoption among developers.  


#### **üìà Qualitative Impact**  
- **Increased Developer Efficiency** ‚Äì Reduces UI development time, enabling quicker project completion.  
- **Bridging Web2 & Web3** ‚Äì Provides tailored solutions for both traditional and decentralized applications.  
- **Enhanced User Experience** ‚Äì Ensures responsive, sleek, and accessible UI designs for end users.  
- **Encouraging Blockchain Adoption** ‚Äì Lowers the entry barrier for dApp development by simplifying UI integration.  
- **Open-Source & Community-Driven** ‚Äì Encourages contributions and continuous improvement.  

---

### **üîó Resources**  
- **GitHub Repository**: [BetaUI GitHub](https://github.com/brightphi210/brightui)  
- **Website**: [BetaUI Official Site](https://betaui.vercel.app/)  
- **Documentation**: [BetaUI Docs](https://betauidocs.vercel.app/docs/Beginning/intro)  
- **Community Telegram**: [Join the BetaUI Community](https://t.me/+i9Xwns8c9qlkYTI0)  

üöÄ **BetaUI is revolutionizing UI development by making it faster, more efficient, and Web3-ready!**

project.title: BetaUI
project.description:
BetaUI ‚Äì A Modular & Sleek UI Library  

What is BetaUI?

BetaUI is a **modular and sleek UI library** designed to help developers build applications and websites without worrying about UI design. It provides **pre-built, customizable components** that streamline the development process, enabling developers to focus on **core functionality** rather than spending excessive time on UI/UX design.  

 **Web3 Components**
BetaUI simplifies Web3 integration with ready-to-use components, including:  
 **NFT Cards** ‚Äì UI elements for displaying NFTs.  
 **Wallet Connection Modal** ‚Äì A seamless interface for connecting crypto wallets.  
 **Successful Transaction Modal** ‚Äì A notification system that confirms blockchain transactions.  
 **Token Swap Interface** ‚Äì A component that simplifies token swapping in decentralized applications (dApps).  etc



 **Web2 Components**  

For traditional web applications, BetaUI also offers:  
 **Customizable Toast Alerts** ‚Äì User-friendly notifications that enhance UX.  
 **Other essential UI elements** ‚Äì Making frontend development faster and more efficient.  

**Impact of BetaUI** 

The primary goal of BetaUI is to **increase development speed and efficiency** by offering pre-built, highly customizable UI components. Here's how it achieves this:  

‚úÖ **Reducing Development Time**  
Eliminates the need for developers to build UI components from scratch, allowing them to focus on **functionality rather than styling and layout**.  
The **modular nature** of BetaUI enables quick integration, making it ideal for **rapid prototyping** and production-ready applications.  

üåê **Bridging the Gap Between Web2 and Web3 UI Design**  
Most UI libraries focus **only** on Web2 interfaces, forcing dApp developers to create Web3 components manually.  
 BetaUI simplifies Web3 integration with **ready-made components** for NFTs, token swaps, wallet connections, and transaction confirmations  etc.

üé® **Enhancing User Experience (UX) for Developers and End Users**  
Developers benefit from **pre-optimized, responsive, and accessible** UI components.  
End users enjoy **sleek, intuitive, and well-designed interfaces** that improve engagement and usability.  

üöÄ **Encouraging Adoption of Blockchain-Based Applications**  
By making Web3 UI integration easier, BetaUI **lowers the entry barrier** for blockchain-based projects.  
This contributes to a **wider adoption of decentralized applications (dApps)** across industries.  

 **üí° Open-Source and Developer-Friendly**  
BetaUI is an **open-source, community-driven** project, allowing developers to **contribute, customize, and extend** its functionality.  

üîó **GitHub Repository**: [https://github.com/brightphi210/brightui](https://github.com/brightphi210/brightui)  

üí¨ **Community Link**: [https://t.me/+i9Xwns8c9qlkYTI0](https://t.me/+i9Xwns8c9qlkYTI0)  

 **üìä Achievements** 
So far, BetaUI has achieved **800+ downloads**, reflecting its growing adoption among developers.  

üîó **Website**: [https://betaui.vercel.app/](https://betaui.vercel.app/)  

üìñ **Documentation**: [https://betauidocs.vercel.app/docs/Beginning/intro](https://betauidocs.vercel.app/docs/Beginning/intro)

project.title: Onyekachukwu Ekoh
project.description:
Hi, I‚Äôm Kachi, a spirited writer and community builder passionate about Web3, sustainability, and making complex ideas easy to understand. From drafting research, blogs, and articles that connect people to blockchain technology and real-world impact. Whether through written content, web3 events, or individual outreach, my goal is to help more people see the potential of decentralized innovation.

What I‚Äôve Done in Web3 & Sustainability.

1. Writing Lead & Member of the Administrative Committee of Borderless Tech Hub UNN:

a. As the writing lead at Borderless Tech Hub UNN, I nurture Web3 writers and enthusiasts who want to kickstart their writing journey of decentralized technology. Beyond writing, I‚Äôm deeply involved in web3 outreach, membership onboarding, community engagement, and event execution.

b. Campus Tour & Awareness Campaign: I and my team members of the Borderless Tech Club UNN visited multiple faculties and student hubs across UNN, reaching 300+ students to educate them on the importance of Web3 while inviting them to the Borderless 3.0 watch party.

c. Led outreach & onboarding, personally inviting 100+ students to attend the event.

d. I hosted the Borderless 3.0 'Byte-On-Chain' Watch party and helped organize this major event, from handling the logistics to following up on our onsite guest speakers and onboarding attendees. This initiative brought together students and blockchain enthusiasts to discuss the future of decentralized technology and how they can make a difference. We registered a total of 39 attendees for the watch party at the venue.

e. Hangouts & Networking: Post-event, I helped coordinate community hangouts, X spaces, and cipher sessions, fostering discussions & connections among attendees and keeping engagement alive beyond the main event.


üîó [Event Highlights & Posts]
https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1850458366742548965?t=uiUlrA_kCigx_1KWg2N0uQ&s=19 
https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1848442771188945034?t=PqHLoSt1mfZaWytYtUQiDQ&s=19 
https://www.instagram.com/p/DEZKxwVNre8/?img_index=3&igsh=MTNpMjgzeTk2MXlybg== 
https://x.com/Borderlessunn/status/1864561799879606318?t=bYyi-NzQAhQKOEEzD6DAiw&s=19 



2. ReFi DAO x Impact Miner Writing Challenge:

I participated in a writing challenge by ReFi DAO and Impact Miner and won 1st place out of the top 5. This was a big moment for me because it reinforced my passion for writing about sustainability and pushed me to continue my journey in blockchain.
https://x.com/ReFiLagos01/status/1875874481505452129?t=Mu7GuJkLrfSohHK5IBgxiA&s=19 

3. Plogging Nigeria
I am the conference coordinator for the Climate Festival 2025, a student-led sustainability group organized by Plogging Nigeria. We‚Äôre currently planning a convention with a hackathon to bring together tech and sustainability to solve real-world problems.
https://x.com/kachi_writes/status/1905489556360528195?t=dslBQf1RWzGW7OYjf7dOjg&s=19

answers.answer:
Refi Uganda is dedicated to advancing regenerative finance (ReFi) and Web3 education in Uganda, with a particular focus on integrating blockchain technology and sustainability practices. Our work spans university campuses and the broader community, aiming to equip students and young professionals with the skills needed to navigate and lead in the emerging Web3 ecosystem.

Key Achievements:
Educational Initiatives:

Conducted Web3 and ReFi workshops at multiple universities across Uganda, reaching over 500 students.
Partnered with local organizations like Celo Uganda and Shamba Network to deliver hands-on blockchain training programs.
Launched online and offline ReFi educational campaigns, providing resources to enhance understanding of decentralized finance and sustainability.
Measurable Impact:

Quantitative:

Over 3000 individuals attended our flagship event in Tororo, where we discussed the intersection of blockchain technology and sustainability.
Trained 10,000 students in Web3 development skills, with a focus on smart contract programming, decentralized applications (dApps), and tokenomics.
Our partnership with Borderless University‚Äôs Web3 club led to the creation of five student-led blockchain projects.
Qualitative:

Increased awareness among university students about the potential of Web3 in creating more transparent and equitable financial systems.
Success stories of student projects, including a decentralized agriculture platform to connect farmers directly with buyers, demonstrating the practical use of blockchain in solving local challenges.
Positive feedback from university faculty, with calls to integrate Web3 education into the standard curriculum.
Long-Term Goals:

Expand Web3 education beyond universities to include rural areas and underserved populations.
Foster a thriving ecosystem of ReFi entrepreneurs and innovators across Uganda, creating opportunities for youth to build decentralized solutions for sustainability.
By integrating both qualitative insights and quantitative results, Refi Uganda is laying the groundwork for a new generation of Web3 pioneers who can leverage these technologies for environmental and social impact.

Refi Uganda has actively engaged in blockchain education and funding initiatives, notably participating in Gitcoin Grants Rounds, including the BioFi Pathfinders Round.‚Äã

Beta Round (May 2023): Refi Uganda secured $3,533.62, comprising $3,195.39 in matching funds and $338.23 in crowdfunding, with contributions from 65 donors
BioFi Pathfinders Round (Gitcoin Grants GG22): In this round, Refi Uganda secured $3,533.62, comprising $3,195.39 in matching funds and $338.23 in crowdfunding, with contributions from 65 donors. ‚Äã

Climate Solutions Round (Gitcoin Grants Beta): Refi Uganda received $8,315.85, including $7,310.00 in matching funds and $1,005.85 in crowdfunding, from 95 donors.‚Äã

Impact of Funding:

The funds raised have significantly bolstered Refi Uganda's blockchain education efforts, enabling the organization to:‚Äã

Educational Workshops: Conduct training sessions on blockchain technology and regenerative finance, enhancing knowledge among university students and community members.‚Äã

Community Engagement: Foster a deeper understanding of decentralized finance and its potential to drive sustainable development within Uganda.‚Äã

These initiatives exemplify Refi Uganda's commitment to integrating blockchain education with regenerative finance, aiming to foster sustainable economic development and environmental stewardship in the region.

The organization‚Äôs focus on regenerative finance (ReFi) aims to tackle environmental and social challenges by leveraging decentralized technologies to create sustainable solutions. Beyond education, Refi Uganda‚Äôs efforts also include empowering local communities with tools to address climate change, promote financial inclusion, and foster entrepreneurship.  As Refi Uganda continues to engage with international communities, including through platforms like Gitcoin, the goal is to build a thriving ecosystem where local talent and global support converge for meaningful change. The journey is about learning, collaborating, and driving positive transformation within Uganda and beyond.  If you're interested in joining the movement or supporting blockchain-based sustainable development projects, there are always opportunities to contribute, whether through education, funding, or partnerships. project.title: Empowering the Next Generation: Web3 Education and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) for Universities in Uganda
project.description:
Refi Uganda seeks to empower university students and young professionals in Uganda by providing comprehensive education and hands-on experience in Web3 technologies and regenerative finance (ReFi). This initiative will build a robust ecosystem of blockchain developers, creatives, and entrepreneurs who will leverage decentralized technologies to address Uganda's environmental and socio-economic challenges. Through partnerships with Web3 universities, tech clubs, and community organizations, this project aims to onboard students, provide career grooming, and foster innovation that drives both local and global public goods.

Project Objectives:
Provide Blockchain Education:

Conduct workshops and training sessions on Web3 technologies such as blockchain fundamentals, smart contract development, decentralized applications (dApps), and decentralized finance (DeFi).
Teach students about regenerative finance (ReFi) and its potential to create sustainable, community-driven financial systems.
Support Student-Led Projects:

Encourage and mentor students in building open-source Web3 projects focused on sustainability, financial inclusion, and other public goods relevant to Uganda.
Provide resources (financial and technical support) for student-led Web3 innovations that aim to address pressing local challenges.
Career Development and Mentorship:

Establish a network of industry experts, mentors, and organizations to offer career development programs, internships, and job opportunities in the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem.
Facilitate workshops, webinars, and networking events with Web3 industry leaders to enhance students' career prospects.
Establish Web3 University Clubs and Collaborations:

Support the formation and growth of university Web3 tech clubs that will serve as hubs for innovation and collaboration.
Foster collaboration between Uganda‚Äôs universities, local tech communities, and global Web3 initiatives, enabling students to access global Web3 networks and opportunities.
Target Audience:
University Students: Primarily targeting students from major universities in Uganda, including those studying computer science, business, economics, environmental science, and related fields.
Student Developers: Engaging students interested in developing decentralized applications, contributing to open-source Web3 projects, and participating in blockchain innovation.
University Faculty & Administrators: Providing faculty with educational resources and training to incorporate blockchain and ReFi topics into university curricula.
Key Activities:
Blockchain Education Workshops:

Conduct in-person and online workshops on Web3 fundamentals, focusing on blockchain technology, smart contracts, tokenomics, decentralized finance (DeFi), and regenerative finance (ReFi).
Facilitate hands-on coding sessions and hackathons for students to develop blockchain projects.
Student Project Incubation:

Launch a grant program to support promising student-led blockchain projects, with a focus on sustainability and public goods.
Provide mentorship, resources, and access to a network of global Web3 developers and organizations.
University Tech Clubs and Collaboration:

Establish Web3 tech clubs within universities to serve as community hubs for blockchain education and project collaboration.
Create inter-university collaboration platforms to facilitate sharing of ideas, projects, and best practices.
Career Development and Networking:

Organize career fairs, workshops, and networking events in collaboration with Web3 companies and blockchain organizations.
Connect students with job opportunities and internships in the blockchain and Web3 sectors.
Expected Outcomes:
Increased Web3 Literacy and Skills:

A large cohort of university students in Uganda will gain a solid understanding of Web3 technologies and regenerative finance, equipping them with the skills necessary to contribute to the global blockchain ecosystem.
Creation of Web3 Solutions for Local Challenges:

Students will apply their knowledge to develop decentralized applications (dApps) that address local issues such as financial inclusion, climate change, and access to sustainable resources.
Growth of the Web3 Ecosystem in Uganda:

A thriving Web3 community will emerge within Ugandan universities, fostering innovation, collaboration, and entrepreneurship in the blockchain space.
Job Opportunities in the Web3 Space:

Students will be better equipped to secure jobs in the rapidly growing Web3 industry, contributing to the local economy and driving further innovation in Uganda.
Project Impact:
Environmental Impact through ReFi Projects:

The project will integrate regenerative finance (ReFi) principles into university curricula and student projects, enabling students to create blockchain solutions that directly contribute to environmental sustainability and climate action in Uganda.
Social Impact via Financial Inclusion:

By focusing on decentralized finance (DeFi) and ReFi, the project will foster greater financial inclusion, allowing underserved communities in Uganda to access financial services and tools that are otherwise unavailable through traditional banking systems.
Economic Impact through Blockchain Innovation:

Graduates of this program will be well-positioned to contribute to Uganda‚Äôs digital economy, with an emphasis on blockchain solutions that drive social, environmental, and economic value. They will also have the skills to create their own startups or contribute to existing blockchain-based organizations.
Timeline:
Phase 1 (Months 1-3):
Conduct outreach and recruitment for university students, faculty, and tech club members.
Organize foundational Web3 workshops and hackathons across major Ugandan universities.
Phase 2 (Months 4-6):
Launch student-led project incubation programs and mentorship.
Continue workshops, training, and hackathons focused on ReFi and DeFi solutions.
Phase 3 (Months 7-12):
Expand career development and job placement programs.
Finalize and support student-led projects with continued mentorship and resources.
Organize a Web3 innovation summit to showcase student projects.
Budget Estimate: 5000 USD

project.title: LB DAO
project.description:
### **What is LB DAO?**

LB DAO(Let‚Äôs build DAO) is **Africa‚Äôs On-Chain Intelligence Hub**, designed to **track, analyze, and provide insights on blockchain transactions and adoption trends** across the continent. Instead of directly building projects, LB DAO **collects real-time on-chain data** to help **developers, investors, and communities make informed decisions** on what to build and fund.

It acts as a **data-driven oracle** for Africa‚Äôs Web3 ecosystem, ensuring that blockchain projects are developed based on real needs rather than assumptions. Through **on-chain governance**, the DAO also enables **community-driven decision-making**, allowing Africans to shape the direction of blockchain adoption on the continent.

### **How is LB DAO Different?**

Unlike other blockchain initiatives in Africa that focus on education, policy advocacy, or direct project development, **LB DAO provides actionable on-chain intelligence.**

### **Key Functions of LB DAO:**

1. **On-Chain Data Tracking:** Analyzing **real-world transaction activity** to understand blockchain adoption in Africa.
2. **Funding Allocation Intelligence:** Helping investors and protocols identify **high-impact Web3 projects** based on data insights.
3. **Governance & Community Engagement:** Using **on-chain voting** to **prioritize and fund** projects that truly benefit African users.
4. **Developer Support & Ecosystem Growth:** Providing insights that help developers build **useful and scalable Web3 applications.**
5. **Education & Community Building:** Through **Let's Build Academy, bootcamps, hackathons, and Web3 events**, we empower African builders with the skills to develop real-world blockchain solutions.

Let's Build DAO has been committed to empowering student developers by providing hands-on Web3 education, mentorship, and real-world opportunities. üöÄ

**Bringing Web3 Education to Campuses**
From mentoring at the Lisk x Borderless Cipher Session to partnering with the Roqqu Campus Tour, we‚Äôve introduced hundreds of students to blockchain technology, onboarding them into our thriving community.
üìå https://x.com/greatAdams01/status/1826217182583255182
üìå https://x.com/letsbuild_dao/status/1893708956666630605

**Building University Blockchain Communities**
We continue to support and collaborate with university blockchain communities, such as Blockchain RSU and Blockchain Uniport, ensuring that students gain access to quality blockchain education and career opportunities.
üìå https://x.com/blockchainrsu_/status/1787781556871807426

**Community-Driven Growth & Advocacy**
Our founder‚Äôs work in blockchain education and advocacy has played a crucial role in shaping the next generation of Web3 builders. From speaking engagements to mentoring, we ensure students receive direct guidance from industry experts.
üìåhttps://x.com/greatAdams01/status/1866590937683497194
üìå https://x.com/_karlagod/status/1867069570042749230

Through these initiatives, Let‚Äôs Build DAO is equipping students and the web3 community with the skills, networks, and experience needed to lead Africa‚Äôs blockchain revolution. üî•
üìå https://x.com/letsbuild_dao/status/1895046452180623508
üìå https://x.com/greatAdams01/status/1871503567410110567

project.title: Frame3 - Designing Web3 Onboarding Experiences
project.description:
Project Description: 
This project focuses on designing and implementing immersive physical spaces and digital environments for Web3 onboarding events, conferences, and hackathons in Universities.

I am Hosanna, an aspiring product & Set designer, and a content creator. I am committed to creating seamless Web3 Onboarding experiences through visually engaging and interactive experiences with event setups, registration booths, interactive installations, and environmental design.

I am focused on ensuring that attendees of Web3 events in Universities‚Äî beginners or seasoned builders‚Äîcan seamlessly connect with blockchain concepts through well-crafted physical and digital environments.

How I‚Äôve Contributed to Web3 Education & Onboarding:
1. Physical Event Setups for Web3 Conferences & Hackathons

Designed registration booths, event structures, and branding installations for Web3 onboarding events, ensuring smooth attendee experiences.

Worked in Borderless 3.0 event, creating an optimized environment for onboarding newcomers into Web3.

Currently working with Borderless UNN HUB to create an engaging space for web3 onboarding in the Hub

https://x.com/hosannabala/status/1901557570734579934
https://x.com/hosannabala/status/1901730414944772362
https://x.com/hosannabala/status/1901730027630125120

2. Web3 Educational Content & Community Engagement

Twitter Threads: Educating on blockchain concepts, onboarding pathways, and the importance of immersive onboarding experiences.

Engaged with Web3 communities on X, highlighting the impact of design in onboarding strategies.

https://x.com/hosannabala/status/1901643510215770402
https://x.com/hosannabala/status/1901891355544338561

 This Funding will help us achieve:

We'd like to expand our work to other Universities to achieve our goal of seamless onboarding into Web3.

Designed and constructed high-quality, reusable registration booths and event structures for Web3 onboarding events, improving attendee flow and engagement.

Invest in better materials and technology (e.g., LED displays, modular booth designs) to create visually captivating onboarding experiences.

Develop more in-depth Twitter threads and digital resources to educate and onboard users into Web3.

Create video content and design guides showcasing effective onboarding environments and setups.

Develop a framework for Web3 event organizers to implement immersive onboarding setups in their spaces.

answers.answer:
As a Web3 content educator, I simplify blockchain concepts and dismantle barriers to adoption through beginner-friendly guides, live workshops, and collaborative community spaces. My work targets students and audiences in Africa, transforming confusion into actionable skills and fostering inclusive participation in decentralized ecosystems.

Impact Measurement
Quantitative Results
Content Reach:

6,000+ views on TikTok (Borderless 3.0 explainer: https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMB2rJsfL/).

4,000+ views on YouTube (token-selling tutorial: https://youtube.com/shorts/ZI4k1jBrydg?si=xW1nhv6I27p5mvhu), enabling 15+ community members to profitably trade tokens.

Onboarding Success:

100+ attendees onboarded to Web3 at the SalvationEnergy event: https://x.com/EnergySalvation/status/1860642151110988245

20+ newsletter sign-ups for Byteonchain.news during Borderless3.0.

10+ students onboarded to Moonwalk, a Web3 fitness app.

Qualitative Results
Community Trust:

Hosted ùïè Spaces (i.e., AtehOfficial space: https://x.com/AtehOfficial/status/1875455775486963750) fostering dialogue on balancing Web3 and education.

Built mentorship networks through live Q&A sessions, reducing isolation for newcomers.

Empowerment:

Demystified Web3 for university students, enabling them to participate confidently.

Localized outreach (e.g., African grassroots events) addressing region-specific barriers.

Key Differentiation
My approach merges practical education (video tutorials, workshops) with community-driven engagement (spaces, partnerships), ensuring learners transition from passive observers to active contributors.

YouTube Token-Selling Tutorial (4k+ views): Turned technical concepts into actionable steps, helping 15+ users profit from token trading.

Grassroots Event Leadership: Masterminded the EnergySalvation event, blending education with interactive participation.

4. Building Open-Access Resources
Beginner Guides: Created easy-to-understand tutorials (e.g., token-selling video) that serve as open-access educational tools.

Collaborative Networks: Built mentorship frameworks through live Q&A sessions, reducing isolation for newcomers.

project.title: Marvvyforchrist
project.description:
## Marvvyforchrist as a web3 content educator.

Web3‚Äôs revolutionary potential is undeniable, but its door remains half-shut to those drowning in technical noise.

Newcomers grapple with fragmented information, opaque jargon, and isolation, barriers that stall adoption.

I‚Äôm dismantling these walls. Through intuitive easy to understand guides, hands-on workshops, ùïè spaces and thriving networks, I‚Äôm transforming onboarding from a solo sprint into a collaborative journey.

My work isn‚Äôt just about simplifying concepts; it‚Äôs about building bridges that turn outsiders into active contributors, ensuring Web3 grows not just bigger, but better with my small quota.

I am passionate and dedicated to simplifying Web3 Jargons to newbies in the borderless ecosystem and do this through Hosting events, preaching Web3 and creating contents!
 
My mission is to make Web3 accessible to everyone, especially students, while fostering engaging conversations that contribute to the community growth and understanding.


# Proof of Work.


Here are my few Contributions to Web3 Onboarding.
 
 * https://x.com/MarvvyFC/status/1848312144195989842

https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMB2rJsfL/

UGC Promotional video for Borderless 3.0

Key Achievements: With over 6k views on TIktok, This video engaged a wide audience, providing information about Borderless 3.0 and why they should attend.



* At Borderless3.0, I helped onboarded people to Byteonchain.news - Media house powered by Borderless dev, and got about 20 persons to sign up for our newsletters.


* https://youtube.com/shorts/ZI4k1jBrydg?si=xW1nhv6I27p5mvhu

Also an easy-to-understand video guide on how to sell tokens.
Key Achievements: With 4k+ views on Youtube, About 15 community members  I know of were able to sell their tokens for profit.


* https://x.com/MarvvyFC/status/1887630527785484306

Onboarded 10 of my course mates to Moonwalk, a fitness app.


* https://x.com/AtehOfficial/status/1875455775486963750

talked to University students how they could balance Web3 and college.


* https://x.com/EnergySalvation/status/1860642151110988245

Masterminded this event, we pulled over 100 persons to Web3 during that event.


* I spoke on an ùïè space where meaningful discussions take place on various topics related to public goods, Newbies onboarding and Web3 at large.

https://x.com/AtehOfficial/status/1875455775486963750

project.title: BORDERLESS TECH HUB KANO
project.description:
Borderless BUK Kano is a university-based Web3 and blockchain innovation club at Bayero University Kano (BUK), Nigeria. As part of the Borderless Tech Hub Kano initiative, our mission is to drive Web3 education, blockchain innovation, and digital empowerment, equipping students and youth with practical skills in decentralized technologies.

Founded in November 2024, Borderless BUK Kano has actively fostered a thriving Web3 community through three+ physical meetups, interactive online sessions, and hands-on blockchain workshops. Our goal is to create a collaborative ecosystem where students explore DeFi, NFTs, smart contract development, and real-world blockchain applications, positioning them for opportunities in the global digital economy.

And as a club we have had three meeting up.
üîó https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1853377996851187897?s=19
üîó https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1882165808505520332?s=19
üîó https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891114939554619561?s=19

Our Goals & Objectives
 
At Borderless BUK Kano, our primary mission is to enhance Web3 adoption and equip students with practical tech skills. In alignment with our 2025 goals and roadmap, we aim to:

Accelerate Web3 onboarding by providing hands-on learning experiences and practical training in blockchain technology.

Expand community growth and engagement through interactive events, collaborations, and knowledge-sharing sessions.

Foster a strong Web3 ecosystem within Bayero University Kano (BUK) by connecting students to real-world opportunities in decentralized technology.


To achieve these objectives, we host a weekly Telegram session, where we provide structured education on Web3 adoption, blockchain fundamentals, and emerging industry trends for students at BUK.

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1882165808505520332?s=19

Expanding Community & Leadership

At Borderless BUK Kano, we are dedicated to scaling Web3 adoption, fostering community growth, and strengthening partnerships. Recently, we collaborated with OXES, a leading Web3 community at Bayero University Kano (BUK), to enhance networking, engagement, and learning opportunities within the campus.

To streamline Web3 onboarding, tech skill development, and community support, we have established club leaders within the Borderless BUK Tech Club. These leaders play a vital role in educating, mentoring, and consistently following up with members, ensuring continuous growth and hands-on learning experiences.

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1878977686032556159?t=RXFPuKhNcHHuFeLcF8BTrQ&s=19


Contribution to web3

1. Hosted 1 watch party in November 2024 for borderless 3.0

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1853377996851187897?s=19 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1850574294075449527?s=19 


2. We had educational sessions on telegram teaching people about the web3 space in general.
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1882165808505520332?s=19 


3. Community Meetup @ BUK. We had 84 people onboarded to the web3 space using BYTEONCHAIN educational tool.
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891111952811757647?s=19 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891113510492385483?s=19 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891114939554619561?s=19 


4. We were the first borderless tech club that started using BYTEONCHAIN educational tool with 84 attestations @ BUK meetup.

https://x.com/EmmanuelBabade/status1891723077014196629?t=c8lFONmhta-9vHiCyDf-SA&s=19


5. We have successfully built club leaders in BUK already. 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1878977686032556159?t=RXFPuKhNcHHuFeLcF8BTrQ&s=19

And we are in the process of building club leaders in kano polytechnic institute.

This our move to kano polytechnic institute 
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1880606293087711443?t=sMyen4zz6QoJkZ_ruLFb-w&s=19


Meet our amazing team members who are making waves in the web3 ecosystem and the ones in training.

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1883635538940608587?t=BTozO5C8iJ0USI4gH9GuVQ&s=19

Project Summary:
Benedict Frank is a Web3 & Cybersecurity Educator focused on democratizing access to decentralized technologies by breaking down complex concepts into jargon-free guides, workshops, and viral content (e.g., TikTok explainers). Addressing fragmented resources and unsafe practices, the project empowers students, creators, and newcomers to participate securely in Web3 ecosystems.
 Key outcomes include:  
- 1,500+ individuals educated through campus events, conferences, and workshops.  
- 500+ trainees contributing to DAOs and open-source projects, scaling ethical innovation.  
- 1,000+ views on cybersecurity TikTok guides and 200+ participants in X/Twitter Spaces on cross-chain governance.  
- Measurable risk reduction: Improved user confidence in avoiding phishing scams and securing wallets.

By fostering grassroots communities and equipping learners with cybersecurity skills, the project strengthens trust in Web3 as a public good.

project.title: BENEDICT FRANK
project.description:
Project Description  
Benedict: Web3 & Cybersecurity Educator | Bridging Knowledge Gaps for Public Good  

Web3‚Äôs promise of decentralization and user empowerment is revolutionary‚Äîyet its complexity and cybersecurity risks alienate newcomers. Students and curious minds face fragmented tutorials, impenetrable jargon, and unsafe practices, stalling adoption and leaving communities vulnerable.

What I Do:
As a Web3 and cybersecurity educator, I dismantle these barriers through:
- Jargon-Free Guides: Transform technical concepts (smart contracts, DAOs, wallet security) into bite-sized, accessible content My resources (open-source guides, free workshops) lower entry barriers, enabling diverse participation in Web3‚Äîa foundational public good for decentralized ecosystems.
.
-  Create innovative and accessible content about web3 and cybersecurity.
By teaching secure practices, I reduce ecosystem risks (e.g., phishing, hacks), protecting users and strengthening trust in public goods infrastructure.

- Community Spaces: Lead ùïè/Twitter discussions and build networks where learners collaborate, ask questions, and grow into contributors.

-  Growing the Builder Pipeline: 500+ students trained through workshops now contribute to DAOs, open-source projects, and grassroots communities, scaling innovation ethically.


 
Proof of Work 
1. Grassroots Onboarding Campaigns  
   - Hosted Borderless 3.0 outreach at RSU Campus, educating 100+ students on Web3‚Äôs societal impact and guiding them to workshops.

https://x.com/BenedictFrank_/status/1883352974745039349

 
   - Co-led the Roqqu Blockchain Conference, onboarding 1,000+ newbies to Web3 tools and decentralized finance.

https://x.com/BenedictFrank_/status/1896599531527217460. 

2. Cybersecurity Advocacy  
   - Graduated from the Borderless Cipher Session with a cybersecurity focus,I shared insights to 25+ attendees on secure wallet practices and phishing prevention.
 https://x.com/BenedictFrank_/status/1811783932074917999. 

   - Created viral TikTok explainers on private key management, reaching 1,000+ views 
https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMBAgCq4o/. 

3. Community Building & Skill Development  
   - Co-hosted ùïè Spaces on Acala Network, teaching 200+ participants about cross-chain interoperability go and decentralized governance https://x.com/i/spaces/1ZkJzRXwqzvJv. 

   - Attended  Borderless Content writing Workshops, empowering 50+ creators to craft clear, jargon-free Web3 content https://x.com/BenedictFrank_/status/1859745398568726958.

project.title: Do Your Own Research Labz
project.description:
DoYourOwnResearchLabz: Empowering the Future of Web3 Builders
About Us
DYORLabz is a Web3 research and development community dedicated to technical education, decentralized innovation, and real-world blockchain applications. We don‚Äôt just teach Web3‚Äîwe bring the industry's most influential voices directly to our community. Through our initiatives, we have hosted some of the most renowned minds in blockchain, including Jesse Pollak (Founder of Base), Rene Reinsberg (Co-founder of Celo), and Fredrik Svantes (Protocol Research Lead), giving the community direct access to the builders shaping the future of decentralized technology.
Since our inception, we have grown into a thriving hub of developers, researchers, and blockchain enthusiasts, working with leading protocols to push the boundaries of decentralization. Our high-impact collaborations for workshops, hackathons, mentorship programs, and hands-on development sprints equip individuals with practical skills, enabling them to contribute meaningfully to Web3 and build the next generation of blockchain solutions.
Beyond education, we are actively transitioning into a research hub and direct link to blockchain brightest minds through guest podcasts ensuring that our community members have direct informed knowledge over governance, web3 advancement and strategic direction.
Our Impact So Far
1.Educational Content Creation:
-Developed comprehensive guides and articles demystifying decentralized finance (DeFi) concepts.
(https://www.doyourownresear.ch/research/onekey-classic-setting-up-guide-best-hardware-wallet-for-security-simplicity)
-Produced podcasts and video content featuring industry leaders discussing the future of finance.
(https://www.doyourownresear.ch/research/exploring-security-with-ethereum-foundations-protocol-security-lead-fredriksvantes)
2.Community Engagement:
-Hosted workshops and webinars with notable figures such as Jesse Pollak (Founder of Base), Rene Reinsberg (Co-founder of Celo), and Fredrik Svantes (Protocol Research Lead), providing our community with direct insights from pioneers in the space.
-Organized local and virtual meetups to foster networking and collaborative learning among members.
(¬†https://zora.co/coin/base:0x029d269da54161ba5626fcff461d6a4e8bb3aa8a?referrer=0x1b371a0d9073DF75d03926f2eF5907A91C9FCc89)
3.Collaborative Initiatives:
Built alliances with Web3 communities like Kenya Blockchain Crypto Conference, Hackquest, LedgerLady, Web3Clubs, and Google Developer Groups in Local universities
Organized in-person training sessions and networking events to foster collaboration
Participated in joint ventures to promote the adoption of decentralized technologies across university blockchain communities.
4. Industry Exposure & Career Mentorship:
Hosted exclusive fireside chats with Web3 pioneers like Jesse Pollak, Rene Reinsberg, and Fredrik Svantes
(https://www.doyourownresear.ch/research/the-genesis-of-base-its-on-chain-strategy-with-base-founder-jesse-pollak)
Connected community members with career mentors, ecosystem grants, and hiring opportunities through constant updates in our website and social media platforms (telegram & dedicated discord server )
(https://discord.gg/jG6Cmk2arQ)
5.Technical Bootcamps & Workshops:
Trained 500+ developers in blockchain fundamentals and smart contract development
Hands-on sessions covering Solidity, AiAgents development using AgentKit & Eliza Frameworks
Collaborations with top ecosystems: Base, Celo, Arbitrum, the Core, EduChain
Why Support Us?
DoYourOwnResearchLabz is not just a research community; it‚Äôs a movement to democratize access to blockchain knowledge and empower the next generation of builders.
By bringing top blockchain founders and industry leaders directly to our community, we are bridging the Web3 knowledge gap while creating career pathways, hands-on innovation opportunities, and a decentralized culture of collaboration.
Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?
University of Nairobi GDG , Web3Clubs, Maseno University Developer CLubs
Club Leads : Victor Ngunyi(University of Nairobi), Felix Awere (Maseno)
Give a summary of your project or your work as an individual, include impact measurement reports (Qualitative & Quantitative).
Do Your Own Research Labz is an edtech as well as research & IRL Workshop provider to universities & Institutions with aim of increasing blockchain adoption by tech communities
Mission: Drive Web3 education, blockchain innovation, and digital empowerment.
Goals:
Enhance Web3 adoption
Equip students & communities with practical tech skills
Foster a strong Web3 ecosystem
Achievements:
Hosted 3+ physical meetups and online sessions
Collaborated with leading Web3 communities
Established club leaders for education and mentorship
Contributed to Web3 through watch parties, educational sessions, and community meetups & webinars
Impact: Empowering students and youth with practical skills in decentralized technologies.
Join us in this mission‚Äîlet‚Äôs build the future of Web3 together! üöÄ

answers.question: Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?

answers.answer:
Career Grooming Through Virtual Assistance: As a Virtual Assistant for the Borderless community, I researched and compiled a list of remote Web3 job opportunities (e.g., smart contract developers, blockchain analysts, UI/UX designers), shared via email with community members, many of whom are university students or recent graduates.  

Onboarding Support at Borderless 3.0: As a performer in the duo JI (Jerry and Ifeanyi), I delivered an acoustic performance at the Borderless Public Goods Concert (Borderless 3.0), engaging 1,880+ attendees and creating a welcoming atmosphere for onboarding activities. As a volunteer, I assisted with event logistics.

Content Creation Through Threads: I‚Äôve written educational threads on X to onboard users into Web3, focusing on university students:  
A thread promoting Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain event reached 1,000+ users.  

A thread on XDegen for newbies reached 600+ users, with 32 engaging via likes/replies.  

A thread on UpRock and DePIN infrastructure reached 50+ users, with several DMing for more info.

Web3 Clan WhatsApp Community: I created and moderate the Web3 Clan WhatsApp community with my brother Ateh, which includes groups like Blockchain Resources, Web3 Bounty Hub, and Tech Events and Webinars. The community grew from 70+ to 160 members in the Web3 Bounty Hub group alone, providing resources, bounty guidance, and event updates.

Proposed Project: Public Beats Concert
I propose the Public Beats Concert, a music-driven event at Rivers State University to onboard 100-200 students into Web3. The event will feature live performances by student artists (including myself) to draw a diverse crowd, followed by workshops on Web3 fundamentals (e.g., setting up crypto wallets, making on-chain transactions), led by university tech clubs like Borderless Tech Club UNIPORT. Attendees will receive snacks, drinks, and a ‚ÄúWeb3 for Musicians‚Äù guide to inspire artists to explore blockchain applications (e.g., NFTs, fair royalty distribution). A live public goods donation demo on the Celo blockchain will show students how to contribute to the ecosystem. The event aims to foster a Web3 community on campus, potentially leading to a Web3-focused music club, and create a replicable model for music-based onboarding across African universities.

Impact Measurement Reports:
Past Contributions (Qualitative & Quantitative):  
Career Grooming Through Virtual Assistance:  
Quantitative: Connected 50-70 community members to Web3 career opportunities through a curated job list, with 10 members reporting applications to roles like blockchain analysts and UI/UX designers (based on feedback via email).  

Qualitative: Empowered university students and recent graduates by providing access to Web3 job opportunities, boosting their confidence to pursue careers in blockchain and decentralized tech.

Onboarding Support at Borderless 3.0:  
Quantitative: Engaged 1,880+ attendees with my performance.

Qualitative: Created a welcoming atmosphere that encouraged non-technical students to participate in Web3 activities, with attendees noting the performance made the event more approachable and engaging (based on verbal feedback).

Content Creation Through Threads:  
Quantitative:  
Borderless 3.0 thread reached 1,000+ users, encouraging 50-70 students to attend the event, where many were onboarded (based on thread replies).  

XDegen thread reached 600+ users, onboarding 15-20 newbies (estimated from messages about setting up XDegen accounts).  

UpRock thread reached 50+ users, onboarding 3-5 newbies (based on feedback from users who joined UpRock).  

Total: Reached 1,650+ users, onboarded 70-100 newbies into Web3.

Qualitative: Simplified complex Web3 concepts (e.g., DeFi trading, DePIN infrastructure) for beginners, with users commenting that the threads were ‚Äúeasy to understand‚Äù and motivated them to explore Web3 tools (e.g., ‚ÄúThanks for explaining XDegen, I‚Äôm trying it out!‚Äù).

Web3 Clan WhatsApp Community:  
Quantitative: Grew the Web3 Bounty Hub group from 70+ to 160 members, onboarded 100+ newbies through shared resources, bounty guidance, and event updates.

Qualitative: Built a supportive community where newbies felt empowered to learn Web3, with members appreciating the practical guidance on bounties and events.

Proposed Project: Public Beats Concert (Expected Impact):  
Quantitative:  
Onboard 100-200 students into Web3.  

At least 50 students will create their first crypto wallet.  

At least 20 students will make their first on-chain transaction.  

Inspire 10+ artists to explore blockchain applications via the ‚ÄúWeb3 for Musicians‚Äù guide (tracked via post-event surveys).

Qualitative:  
Create an inclusive entry point for non-technical students, making Web3 accessible through music and fostering a sense of community among diverse disciplines (arts, humanities, sciences).  

Build a Web3-focused music club on campus, encouraging ongoing engagement with blockchain technology.  

Establish a replicable model for music-based Web3 onboarding, inspiring other African universities to adopt similar initiatives (tracked via interest from other campuses post-event).

1. Onboarding Support at Borderless 3.0 (November 2023)
Activity Description: As a performer and volunteer at the Borderless Public Goods Concert (Borderless 3.0), I contributed to onboarding university students into Web3. I performed as part of the duo JI (Jerry and Ifeanyi), delivering an acoustic set that engaged 1,880+ attendees, many of whom were university students new to Web3. My performance created a welcoming atmosphere, encouraging participation in onboarding activities like the Gitcoin booth, where students learned about public goods and made their first on-chain donations. As a volunteer, I assisted with event logistics.

Quantitative Impact:  
Engaged 1,880+ attendees with my performance.  



Qualitative Impact:  
Created an inclusive environment that made Web3 approachable for non-technical students, with attendees noting that the performance made the event more engaging and encouraged them to explore Web3 activities (based on verbal feedback).  

Strengthened the Borderless community‚Äôs efforts to onboard African university students, aligning with the round‚Äôs focus on university tech clubs and onboarding initiatives.

Evidence:  
X post promoting Borderless 3.0: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985 

My role as a performer and volunteer is documented in the application, with photos of the event showing students engaging with Web3 activities.
Evidence:  
X post About my performance at the Borderless 3.0 Public Goods Concert: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1857913995920842779

2. Content Creation Through Educational Threads on X
Activity Description: I‚Äôve written educational threads on X to onboard university students into Web3 and promote blockchain education, focusing on the Borderless community and African university audiences. These threads simplify Web3 concepts and encourage participation in blockchain initiatives.  

Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain Event Thread: Promoted the Borderless 3.0 event, highlighting its focus on blockchain mastery and AI innovation, encouraging students to attend and engage with Web3 workshops.  

XDegen for Newbies Thread: Explained XDegen, a platform for safe DeFi trading, providing beginner-friendly education on Web3 tools.  

UpRock and DePIN Infrastructure Thread: Educated users on UpRock and Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks (DePIN), explaining how to contribute to decentralized web data infrastructure for AI and earn rewards.

Quantitative Impact:  
Borderless 3.0 thread reached 1,000+ users, encouraging 50-70 students to attend the event, where many were onboarded into Web3 (based on thread replies).  

XDegen thread reached 600+ users, onboarding 15-20 newbies (estimated from messages about setting up XDegen accounts), with 32 users engaging via likes/replies.  

UpRock thread reached 50+ users, onboarding 3-5 newbies (based on feedback from users who joined UpRock).  

Total: Reached 1,650+ users, onboarded 70-100 newbies into Web3 through educational content.

Qualitative Impact:  
Simplified complex Web3 concepts (e.g., DeFi trading, DePIN infrastructure) for university students, making blockchain education accessible. Users commented that the threads were ‚Äúeasy to understand‚Äù and motivated them to explore Web3 tools  

Increased awareness of Web3 opportunities among African university students, aligning with the round‚Äôs goal of fostering blockchain education.

Evidence:  
Borderless 3.0 thread: x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985.  

XDegen thread: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1901765931027619892.  

UpRock thread: https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1903945107142762511.  

Engagement metrics (likes, replies, DMs) are visible on the threads, showing user interaction and interest.

3. Web3 Clan WhatsApp Community
Activity Description: I created and moderate the Web3 Clan WhatsApp community with my brother Ateh, focusing on onboarding newbies into Web3, particularly university students. The community includes groups like Blockchain Resources (sharing educational materials), Web3 Bounty Hub (teaching bounty applications and thread contests), and Tech Events and Webinars (promoting Web3 events). I share my experiences from attending Borderless events and other Web3 initiatives to guide newbies.  

Quantitative Impact:  
Grew the Web3 Bounty Hub group from 70+ to 160 members.  

Onboarded 100+ newbies by sharing resources, teaching bounty applications, and promoting events.  



Qualitative Impact:  
Built a supportive community where African university students and newbies felt empowered to learn Web3, with members appreciating the practical guidance.  

Fostered a sense of community and collaboration, aligning with the round‚Äôs focus on Web3 University Tech Clubs and community-driven education.

Evidence:  
The Web3 Clan WhatsApp community exists and can be verified by joining the group (though I cannot share the link publicly due to privacy). Screenshots of the group‚Äôs growth (from 70+ to 160 members) and member testimonials can be provided upon request.  

My role as the creator and moderator is documented in the application.

4. Career Grooming Through Virtual Assistance
Activity Description: As a Virtual Assistant for the Borderless community, I researched and compiled a list of remote Web3 job opportunities (e.g., smart contract developers, blockchain analysts, UI/UX designers) tailored to the skills of Borderless members, many of whom are university students or recent graduates. The list was shared via email, supporting career development in Web3.  

Quantitative Impact:  
Connected 50-70 community members to Web3 career opportunities.  


Qualitative Impact:  
Empowered university students by providing access to Web3 job opportunities, boosting their confidence to pursue careers in blockchain and decentralized tech.  

Supported the round‚Äôs focus on career development in African universities by bridging the gap between education and employment in Web3.

Evidence:  
The job list was shared via email with Borderless community members, and I can provide a sample of the list or email distribution records upon request.
