Public Goods Ecosystem Support: I‚Äôve supported the Public Goods ecosystem by facilitating on-chain donations at Borderless 3.0, teaching Web3 Clan members how to earn through bounties (some tied to public goods), and educating users on tools like UpRock that contribute to decentralized infrastructure.

project.title: Public Beats Concert
project.description:
GM GM,

I‚Äôm Ifeanyichukwu Maulepe Ugoji, a Virtual Assistant, Content Creator, Guitarist, Performer, and dedicated Web3 Contributor and Creative who has been actively involved in the Web3 ecosystem after joining the Borderless Web3 Community in November 2023. 

Over the past 16 months, I‚Äôve attended more than 20 tech events, including Web3 initiatives hosted by Borderless, Solana All-Stars, Lisk, and other leading brands, focusing on African university communities. 

As a member of the Borderless community, I‚Äôve contributed to onboarding and career grooming in blockchain education through my diverse roles: as a Virtual Assistant researching Web3 job opportunities, a content creator writing educational threads, a performer engaging audiences, and a volunteer facilitating onboarding at events like the Borderless Public Goods Concert (Borderless 3.0).

Career Grooming Through Virtual Assistance: As a Virtual Assistant for the Borderless community, I researched and compiled a comprehensive list of remote tech job opportunities and freelance roles in Web3 development, blockchain, and UI/UX design, tailored to the skills of Borderless Web 3 Community members, many of whom are university students or recent graduates. This list, shared via email, included roles like smart contract developers, blockchain analysts, and UI/UX designers for decentralized applications. My work directly supported career grooming by connecting community members to Web3 career opportunities.

Onboarding Support at Borderless 3.0: As a performer, I delivered an acoustic live performance that engaged over 1,880+ attendees, many of whom were university students new to Web3. 

I‚Äôm part of a duo named JI (Jerry and Ifeanyi), Our performance as a duo created a welcoming atmosphere, encouraging attendees to participate in onboarding activities, such as the Gitcoin booth, where participants learned about public goods and made their first on-chain donations. I sang and played the guitar while my bandmate Jerry took the lead with his amazing vocals. As a volunteer, I assisted with event logistics, and set up the venue, Through these efforts, I contributed uniquely to onboarding students into Web3 during the event.

Content Creation Through Threads: As a content creator, I‚Äôve written educational threads on X to onboard users into Web3 and promote blockchain education, with a focus on university students and the Borderless community:

#Promoting Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain Event: 
I created a thread x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1826285446567276985  to promote the Borderless 3.0 Byte Onchain event, inviting people to attend and highlighting its focus on blockchain mastery and AI innovation. The thread, part of a 12-post series, reached 1,000+ users and encouraged students to attend the event, many of whom were onboarded into Web3 through the event‚Äôs workshops (as detailed in the thread‚Äôs replies).

#Explaining XDegen for Newbies:
I wrote a thread https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1901765931027619892  about XDegen, a platform that helps newbies learn and navigate Degen trading without making losses. This thread provided beginner-friendly education on safe trading practices in Web3, reaching 600+ users and onboarding them into Web3 by introducing them to practical tools for decentralized finance (DeFi), as evidenced by 32 users who engaged with the thread via likes or replies expressing interest in trying XDegen.

#Discussing UpRock and DePIN Infrastructure: 
I created a thread https://x.com/ifeanyi70765182/status/1903945107142762511  about UpRock and DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks) infrastructure, explaining how users can contribute to decentralized web data infrastructure for AI and earn rewards. Based on the engagement I observed, this thread reached 50+ users, with users commenting or DMing me to learn more about joining UpRock.




#My Direct Contribution to onboarding newbies into Web3

I also created and moderate a WhatsApp Community alongside my younger brother Ateh, called Web3 Clan that helps newbies navigate this complex world of Web3.

I share my experiences from attending Borderless events, workshops, and other Web3 events. The community is made up of different groups like Blockchain Resources - where I share educational resources on Web3 to newbies, - Web3 Bounty Hub - where I teach newbies how to apply for bounties, thread contests, and more, I share my expertise having written amazing threads in the past, - Tech Events and Webinars - where I share upcoming tech and Web3 events and webinars. The Web3 Clan WhatsApp community, which I created and moderate with my brother Ateh, grew in numbers on the first day of creation, especially the Web3 Bounty Hub group which grew from 70+ members to 160 at the moment. I‚Äôve onboarded over 100 newbies by sharing resources, teaching bounty applications, and promoting events.



#I‚Äôd like to propose a Public Beats Concert‚Äîa music-driven event to onboard university students into Web3 at Rivers State University.

My motivation for hosting the Public Beats Concert stems from my firsthand understanding of how music can bridge communities and make complex concepts like blockchain more accessible. Having witnessed the impact of events like Borderless 3.0, where I performed alongside my bandmate Jerry and supported onboarding efforts, I saw how combining entertainment with education can engage diverse audiences. I want to replicate this model at my university, using music as a universal language to introduce students to Web3, foster innovation, and strengthen the Web3 community on campus.


#Event Concept
The Public Beats Concert, an event at Rivers State University designed to onboard 100-200 students into the Web3 ecosystem through a unique blend of live music performances and educational workshops. The concert will feature performances by well-known student artists (including myself), creating an engaging atmosphere that draws students in, followed by interactive workshops on Web3 fundamentals. These workshops, led by university tech club members or Web3 educators, will cover practical topics like setting up a crypto wallet, making on-chain transactions, and understanding public goods‚Äîcore concepts of the Web3 ecosystem. To enhance the experience, I‚Äôll provide attendees snacks and drinks, create a welcoming environment, and distribute a short guide, ‚ÄúWeb3 for Musicians,‚Äù to show how blockchain can benefit artists (e.g., through NFTs or fair royalty distribution).

The event will promote blockchain education and innovation by making Web3 accessible to non-technical students who might not attend traditional tech workshops. Music will serve as the hook, drawing a diverse crowd, while the workshops will provide hands-on learning opportunities. I‚Äôll also incorporate a live demonstration of a public goods donation (e.g., donating to a Gitcoin Grant on the Celo blockchain), showing students how they can contribute to the ecosystem in real-time. Expected outcomes include onboarding 100-200 students into Web3, with at least 50 creating their first crypto wallet and 20 making their first on-chain transaction during the event. Additionally, the ‚ÄúWeb3 for Musicians‚Äù guide will inspire at least 10 artists to explore blockchain applications in their careers.

#How This Funding Supports the Public Beats Concert:

This funding will support the Public Beats Concert by covering essential event costs and enabling me to purchase a semi-acoustic guitar. The guitar will ensure a high-quality performance that creates an engaging atmosphere, drawing 100-200 students to the event and inspiring them to explore Web3 through our workshops, while also equipping me to perform at future Web3 events, like a regional concert series with Borderless Tech Club UNIPORT, to onboard more students across African universities.



#Impact and Benefits
The Public Beats Concert will significantly contribute to the growth of the Web3 community within Rivers State University by creating a new entry point for students to engage with blockchain technology. By combining music with education, the event will attract a diverse audience, including non-technical students who might otherwise feel intimidated by Web3. This inclusivity aligns with the grant‚Äôs goal of fostering blockchain education in African universities, as it ensures that students from various disciplines‚Äîarts, humanities, sciences‚Äîcan participate and learn. The concert will also build a community of music lovers interested in Web3, potentially leading to the formation of a Web3-focused music club on campus.

The event will foster collaboration between creative and tech communities at the university, bridging a gap that often exists in Web3 education. I plan to partner with university tech clubs, such as Borderless Tech Club UNIPORT, Solana All-Stars, Blockchain RSU, and Blockchain UNIPORT to lead the workshops and provide technical expertise. Additionally, I‚Äôll leverage my network from attending 20+ Web3 events to invite influencers or educators from Borderless, Solana All-Stars, or Lisk to speak at the event and promote it on X, amplifying its reach. 

#Conclusion
The Public Beats Concert is a unique opportunity to onboard 100-200 students into Web3 at Rivers State, using music as a universal language to make blockchain education accessible and engaging. By combining live performances with hands-on workshops, the concert will foster innovation, build a Web3 community on campus, and create a replicable model for music-based onboarding. 

I‚Äôm thrilled at the opportunity to contribute to the Web3 ecosystem through this grant, and I‚Äôm committed to making the Public Beats Concert a success. With the support of the "Web3 for Universities" grant, I‚Äôll create a memorable event that not only onboards students but also inspires them to explore blockchain innovation, strengthening the Web3 community in African universities.

project.title: GeeWrites
project.description:
Everyone can learn and use web3, but someone must simplify it. 
My name is Glory Wejinya. I am a content writer, social media manager, and Web 3 Virtual assistant.
I got onboarded into Web3 in 2023 right after Borderless 2.0 and the next best thing after getting onboarded is getting others to learn about Web3 and sharing insights about web3 projects. 

The project is about simplifying Web3 for newbies, making it accessible and understandable. 

The project aims to:

Increase Web3 adoption by breaking down complex concepts.
Empower individuals with the knowledge to navigate Web3.
Support Web3 development by assisting builders.
Promote financial literacy within the crypto space.
Bridge the knowledge gap between those already in Web3 and those who are new to it.



Web 3 Educational and Onboarding activities

Onboarded a newbie into web 3; from downloading MetaMask to successfully creating her account, educating her on the importance of keeping her passphrase safe to making her first transactions 
https://x.com/gloorry_/status/1866956225747021924?s=46


As a way to contribute to more web3 projects, I wrote an educative and  explanatory article on the Lisk Blockchain
https://medium.com/@glorywejinya/lisk-blockchain-and-their-superchain-launch-on-optimism-opstack-what-is-it-and-how-it-affects-c13860566fc8


I wrote a very simple yet detailed article on Near protocol, what it is and how it 
https://medium.com/@glorywejinya/why-stay-far-away-when-you-can-be-near-5a3146bb679a


As a youth Corper in Nigeria I created an educational twitter thread highlighting the importance of getting a tech skill especially in web 3. I urged youths to embrace web3 

https://x.com/gloorry_/status/1843279459455234510?s=46


Speaker management in Borderless 3.0, where I ensured the speakers had adequate information about the event to be able to educate the audience. Managed them and ensured they got maximum support before, during and after the event 
https://x.com/gloorry_/status/1854638694658986288?s=46


Churned out content for the publicity of Borderless and crafted a content calendar for the various social media pages 
https://x.com/gloorry_/status/1824721061667037533?s=46


As a social media manager of Bitsave, a web3 product- a crypto saving dapp, I went to the university educating students on what Bitsave is and various ways to save 
Here‚Äôs a link to the video. 
https://x.com/gloorry_/status/1811406468920270977?s=46


I alongside the team at Bitsave organized the first ever Bitsavvy Pizza party where we onboarded techies and educated them on personal finance in web 3 
https://x.com/gloorry_/status/1850260340581273993?s=46


I have moderated  various ùïè spaces where we educated attendees on savings and importance as income earners 

https://x.com/bitsaveprotocol/status/1846516807785402854?s=46

https://x.com/bitsaveprotocol/status/1856659061267157048?s=46


Web3 Activities as a Virtual Assistant 

I am an experienced Virtual Assistant with a vast knowledge of Web3 education and onboarding. I take up scheduling activities, reminders, follow-up up and ensure Web3 Builders and Founders are actively building and onboarding people into web 3 and also enable them focus on the main work at hand.

This is a link to KarlaGod profile, She is a builder and founder whom I assist.
https://x.com/_karlagod

project.title: Ebubechi Anyanwu - Web3 Tutor and Contributor
project.description:
Empowering the Next Generation of Web3 Developers

I‚Äôm Ebubechi Anyanwu, a web development tutor and mentor dedicated to equipping aspiring developers with the skills needed to thrive in the digital space. My journey began with Borderless in July 2022, where I sharpened my frontend development expertise before transitioning into mentorship and education. Since then, I have trained over 50 students in web design and development, guiding them toward building real-world projects and launching their careers.

My Contributions to Web3 Through Education & Mentorship:

- I train and mentor university students in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern qframeworks, helping them build interactive and functional web applications.
- I have led workshops and training sessions, enabling students to transition from Web2 to Web3 development by introducing blockchain-based technologies.
- I foster a collaborative developer community, where aspiring talents can learn, grow, and contribute to Web3 projects.
- I provide structured learning resources through our GitHub repository, ensuring students have access to high-quality educational materials: https://github.com/B-rder-ess-Dev-Hub

One of my students, Akivie, has successfully transitioned from learning to contributing to the Web3 ecosystem. He played a key role in developing Manilla Vault, a crypto staking platform that offers LP staking, yield rewards, and financial flexibility through tiered pools. Here's the app link - https://manilla-vault.vercel.app/

Beyond just teaching, I am committed to bridging the gap between education and real-world application. By mentoring developers, providing hands-on training, and fostering innovation, I help students gain the confidence to contribute meaningfully to the Web3 space.
I‚Äôm always open to collaborations and opportunities that expand Web3 education and empower the next generation of developers!

project.title: Sunday Kingsley Uchenna UI/UX Designer | Web3 Educator | Photographer
project.description:
#### My Web3 Design & Education Journey

I‚Äôm Sunday Kingsley Uchenna, a UI/UX Designer passionate about creating human-centered digital experiences. My journey into design started under Borderless, where I honed my skills and eventually transitioned into tutoring, mentoring numerous students in UI/UX and Web3 design. Beyond teaching, I‚Äôve contributed to multiple Web3 projects and communities, designing impactful platforms and participating in media documentation as a photographer.

#### Contributing to Web3 Through Design & Education

# 1. Teaching & Mentorship
As a tutor, I have guided numerous students through UI/UX design, helping them build strong foundations in Web3 product design.

Led workshops and training sessions, onboarding designers into the Web3 space with practical, real-world applications.

### 2. Key Design Contributions
I have designed and contributed to several Web3 projects, ensuring usability, accessibility, and intuitive user experiences. Some notable projects include:

*  Let‚Äôs Build DAO Website ‚Äì Designed an intuitive website for Let‚Äôs Build DAO, enhancing user interaction and onboarding. üîó https://academy.letsbuilddao.org/ 

* StreamLivr Web3 Streaming App ‚Äì Among the designers of StreamLivr, a Web3 streaming platform that enables seamless gifting and wallet imports. üîó https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=kn.streamlivr.app 

* Borderless Websites ‚Äì Co designed the Borderless websites, improving community engagement and accessibility. üîó https://borderless.cryptosmartnow.io/ 

* Byte on Chain Website ‚Äì Contributed to the design of Byte on Chain, a platform aimed at seamless blockchain integration. üîó https://byteonchain.xyz/ 

*  Event Media Upload/Download Website (Borderless 3.0) ‚Äì Designed a user-friendly platform for uploading and accessing event media. üîó https://borderless3-0.vercel.app/ 

### 3. Photography & Media Contributions

Beyond design, I have actively participated in Web3 and tech community events as a photographer, capturing and documenting key moments. Some notable contributions include:

* Borderless 2.0 & 3.0 Media Team ‚Äì Covered major events, ensuring quality documentation and media accessibility. 

* Avalanche Game Event ‚Äì Documented the event, providing high-quality visual content for community engagement. https://x.com/kevin_chibuoyim/status/1869788253286740396 

* Lisk End-of-Year Event (Port Harcourt) ‚Äì Served as a photographer, contributing to event storytelling and media coverage. https://x.com/iamkvisuals/status/1871208246310289471 

### Building the Future of Web3

My passion for Web3 extends beyond just design‚ÄîI am committed to fostering adoption through intuitive user experiences, education, and community engagement. Whether it's through mentoring the next generation of designers or building accessible platforms, I aim to bridge the gap between technology and users.

Always open to collaboration and new opportunities to push Web3 forward!

project.title: iChristwin | M3tering Protocol
project.description:
Founder, Switch Electric | Core Contributor, M3tering protocol

As an early pioneer in the web3 space, I bring a unique blend of technological innovation, sustainable energy solutions, and community-driven leadership. I founded Switch Electric with the mission of integrating renewable energy into decentralized ecosystems, and I actively contribute to the M3tering protocol to push the boundaries of blockchain-based energy solutions.

Over the past year, I have contributed immensely to the transformative initiative of bringing a Borderless Hub to the University of Nigeria, Nsukka campus.
![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1294966868666224720/1351448718087557120/PXL_20250302_190433973.jpg?ex=67da6a33&is=67d918b3&hm=178cbe8057225b8be0371fb2dec5f737b6bb11a572639b70a76ce2a72add9b4f&)

I successfully provided solar electrification to the newest Borderless hub at the University of Nigeria Nsukka campus. This project not only brought sustainable, round-the-clock electricity to the hub at no cost but also established a scalable model using pay-as-you-go electricity as a service.

I also played an instrumental role in negotiations for a workspace venue within the university campus, ensuring that the hub has a stable, dedicated environment to thrive. And by installing all the necessary solar equipment free of charge, I have helped reduce operational costs of the hub and reduced the associated risks for creating a new hub.

As an OG in the web3 community, I am passionate about knowledge sharing and collaboration. I look to often offer tech talks and lectures to student members of the hub, aiming to foster innovation and bridge the gap between traditional energy solutions and modern decentralized technology. Additionally, I am committed to supporting the annual Borderless conference as a guest speaker, promoting collaboration among the diverse web3 communities I lead.
![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1294966868666224720/1351449842521477191/Snapchat-1426878850.jpg?ex=67da6b3f&is=67d919bf&hm=a6e3b5187fe1905045b7778305cb0131f7e5c086eead839e3d7499f49da8e89e&)


Leveraging our successful model at Nsukka, I aim to support the creation of more Borderless hubs equipped with pay-as-you-go solar electrification. I will continue promoting cross-community collaboration to bridge the gap between web3 innovations and real-world applications, ensuring that funding translates into measurable, positive change.

I am eager to expand these initiatives, deepen community engagement, and further establish Borderless as a leading example of the convergence between sustainable energy and blockchain technology.

project.description:
#### About

# My Web3 Development & Education Journey
I am Nworah Chimzuruoke Gabriel, a passionate Web3 developer and educator dedicated to building decentralized applications (dApps) and mentoring developers in blockchain technology. My journey into Web3 began with a strong focus on smart contract development, and blockchain infrastructure, leading to contributions across multiple projects and ecosystems.
Beyond coding, I am committed to education and mentorship, helping onboard new developers through workshops, training sessions, and open-source contributions. My work spans across Ethereum, Arbitrum, Optimism, Celo, Base, and other EVM-compatible chains.

# Key Development Contributions
I have built and contributed to multiple Web3 projects that focus on blockchain attestations, decentralized identity, and blockchain-based learning platforms.
* ## ByteOnChain Attestation
    designed the attestation system to verify quiz details for onboarding events and courses on multiple networks
    üîó https://byteonchain.xyz
* ##  MetIRL Attestation for Borderless 3.0 Tech Event
    provided on-chain attestations for participants at Borderless 3.0, ensuring proof of event participation and engagement using Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS)
    üîó  https://attest-six.vercel.app/

# Teaching & Mentorship in Web3 Development
I am dedicated to educating and onboarding developers into Web3, helping them build strong foundations in Solidity, smart contract development, and decentralized applications. Through workshops, mentorship programs, and hands-on training, I have contributed to growing the Web3 developer community.

# Developer Workshops & Training Sessions
I have led multiple Solidity training sessions and developer on-boarding workshops, guiding participants through the fundamentals of smart contract development and real-world dApp implementation. Some highlights include:
* ## Web3 Developer Workshops
    Mentored developers in workshops focused on Solidity, smart contract security, and blockchain development.
* ## Hands-On Solidity Training
    Provided practical, project-based learning experiences for developers transitioning into Web3.
* ## Blockchain Uniport Mentorship
    Led a dedicated mentorship session with Blockchain Uniport, supporting students in understanding blockchain development and decentralized applications.
     üîó https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1826246830847603082
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1824893546496729378

* ## Borderless Tech Club Space
    Hosted a Twitter Space with Borderless Tech Club Uniport, discussing blockchain development and the future of Web3.
     üîó https://x.com/Borderless_Ph/status/1814542287164109280
* ## Onchain Summer Hackathon
    Participated in and contributed to the Onchain Summer Hackathon, sharing insights on blockchain innovation.
    üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1806328814366028259
* ## Product Presentation at Borderless Dev Hub
    Delivered a presentation for the Mamashay product, showcasing development strategies and product vision.
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1801147956457881737
* ## Developer Review for Darwinia Project
    Conducted a technical review of the Darwinia project, providing insights on its blockchain infrastructure.
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1786438558519091474
* ## Mentorship Space with Mently
    Engaged in a discussion with Mently, sharing guidance on Web3 development and career growth.
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1784281773737672838
* ## Tutoring at Borderless Dev Hub
    Led a tutoring session at Borderless Dev Hub, helping aspiring developers transition into the blockchain space.
     üîó https://x.com/_karlagod/status/1781255706785554612
* ## Volunteering at Arbitrum PH Event
    Contributed as a volunteer at the first Arbitrum PH event, supporting blockchain education and adoption.
     üîóhttps://x.com/Borderless_Ph/status/1771779730397638782

I have built and contributed to multiple Web3 projects that focus on blockchain attestations, decentralized identity, and blockchain-based learning platforms.
* ## ByteOnChain Attestation
    designed the attestation system to verify quiz details for onboarding events and courses on multiple networks
    üîó https://byteonchain.xyz
* ##  MetIRL Attestation for Borderless 3.0 Tech Event
    provided on-chain attestations for participants at Borderless 3.0, ensuring proof of event participation and engagement using Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS)
    üîó  https://attest-six.vercel.app/

# Teaching & Mentorship in Web3 Development
I am dedicated to educating and onboarding developers into Web3, helping them build strong foundations in Solidity, smart contract development, and decentralized applications. Through workshops, mentorship programs, and hands-on training, I have contributed to growing the Web3 developer community.

# Developer Workshops & Training Sessions
I have led multiple Solidity training sessions and developer on-boarding workshops, guiding participants through the fundamentals of smart contract development and real-world dApp implementation. Some highlights include:
* ## Web3 Developer Workshops
    Mentored developers in workshops focused on Solidity, smart contract security, and blockchain development.
* ## Hands-On Solidity Training
    Provided practical, project-based learning experiences for developers transitioning into Web3.
* ## Blockchain Uniport Mentorship
    Led a dedicated mentorship session with Blockchain Uniport, supporting students in understanding blockchain development and decentralized applications.
     üîó https://x.com/BchainUniport/status/1826246830847603082
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1824893546496729378
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1824893601932841310
* ## Borderless Tech Club Space
    Hosted a Twitter Space with Borderless Tech Club Uniport, discussing blockchain development and the future of Web3.
     üîó https://x.com/Borderless_Ph/status/1814542287164109280
* ## Onchain Summer Hackathon
    Participated in and contributed to the Onchain Summer Hackathon, sharing insights on blockchain innovation.
    üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1806328814366028259
* ## Product Presentation at Borderless Dev Hub
    Delivered a presentation for the Mamashay product, showcasing development strategies and product vision.
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1801147956457881737
* ## Developer Review for Darwinia Project
    Conducted a technical review of the Darwinia project, providing insights on its blockchain infrastructure.
     üîó https://x.com/NworahGabriel/status/1786438558519091474
* ## Mentorship Space with Mently
    Engaged in a discussion with Mently, sharing guidance on Web3 development and career growth.

* ## Volunteering at Arbitrum PH Event
    Contributed as a volunteer at the first Arbitrum PH event, supporting blockchain education and adoption.

answers.answer:
Our mission is to drive awareness, education, and real-world application of blockchain technology among students at the University of Lagos and across Nigeria. Since inception, we have hosted over 15 campus events, workshops, and developer bootcamps, all designed to explain blockchain concepts and equip students with hands-on skills.

Key Achievements and Impact:
Blockchain in Unilag Conference 2023:
Our flagship event hosted over 1,000 students, featuring industry leaders from Avax, Consensys, and Ethereum Nigeria.
We ran a Pitch Competition with 30 submissions and the 2 pitchathon winners are currently under incubation 

Hackathon X Base:
Partnered with Ethereum Nigeria, Base Africa and other communities to host a hackathon with over 30 submissions and 30+ devs on site.

DND Workshop:
We conducted a 3 day onboarding workshop, we introduced over 150 students into the concept of D (DeFi), N (NFTs), and D (DAOs). 

Partnership Growth:
We have also secured partnership with numerous organizations and helped them carry out various events across Unilag and the broader Lagos. Some of these partnerships are Ethereum nig, Starknet Africa. Base Africa, Consensys, Web3Bridge etc

Training Tracks:
For our 500+ community members, we have various community tracks that we host on various days of the week to train them and equip them with sufficient skills for them to earn in the web3 space. We have our Trading track, Dev track and Non-tech tracks.

project.title: PlutoDev
project.description:
I am Plutodev, 
A blockchain professional and Tech Contributor.
Over the past year, I‚Äôve led several Web3 onboarding initiatives, ranging from workshops, training programs, and Twitter Spaces to community events and live sessions.
Project Description
ChainConnectNG is a community dedicated to onboarding and supporting developers interested in developer relations within the Web3 space.
This initiative compiles resources, efforts, and insights into a comprehensive, open-source software for Web3 developer education.
Beyond education, ChainConnectNG will provide earning opportunities for developers looking to explore the possibilities of blockchain technology. The platform will feature resources, tools, and best practices, making it easier for individuals and communities to access and adopt Web3.
What This Project Will Deliver
1. A Comprehensive Developer Relations Playbook
	‚Ä¢	Event strategies and best practices: A detailed look at how I‚Äôve organized Web3 onboarding events, including successes and lessons learned.
	‚Ä¢	Curated learning resources: A collection of Web3 tools, platforms, and educational content designed for developer onboarding.
	‚Ä¢	Step-by-step onboarding guides: Practical advice for developers entering Web3, including clear instructions, common pitfalls, and suggested learning paths.
	‚Ä¢	Community engagement insights: Lessons learned from building developer communities and creating engaging, high-value content.
Why This Matters for Web3 Developer Adoption
	‚Ä¢	Scalability & Impact: ChainConnectNG is designed to scale beyond my individual efforts, providing a structured resource that others can use to onboard developers efficiently.
	‚Ä¢	Empowering Developers: By centralizing resources for Web3 developer relations, we lower entry barriers and accelerate adoption.
	‚Ä¢	Open-Source Knowledge Sharing: The project ensures that Web3 developer education remains free, accessible, and open to all.
Target Audience
	‚Ä¢	Developers: Individuals interested in Web3 developer relations who want to learn, contribute, and earn rewards.
	‚Ä¢	Partners: Web3 businesses, projects, and educational initiatives seeking developer engagement.
Key Features
	‚Ä¢	User Accounts: Developers can create profiles to track their engagement and learning progress.
	‚Ä¢	Earning Mechanism: Users earn blockchain-based rewards for active participation.
	‚Ä¢	Partner Dashboard: Projects can list their initiatives and engage with developers.
	‚Ä¢	Activity Tracking: A system to measure developer contributions and interactions.
	‚Ä¢	Reward System: A transparent mechanism for distributing rewards based on meaningful activity.
How I‚Äôve Contributed to Web3 Education

	‚Ä¢	Helped 200+ individuals transition into Web3 by providing practical knowledge on the tools and platforms that support blockchain projects.
	‚Ä¢	Actively contributed to Web3 initiatives through content creation, workshops, and mentoring.

answers.answer:
# **Project Summary: VinuChain Africa University Outreach**

VinuChain Africa University Outreach is a community-driven initiative aimed at educating and onboarding university students across Africa into the Web3 and blockchain ecosystem. Through strategic partnerships, workshops, and hands-on training, we are fostering a new generation of blockchain enthusiasts, developers, and entrepreneurs.

## **Our Key Activities**
- **Educational Workshops & Conferences**: Hosted events at **University of Lagos (UNILAG)** and **Obafemi Awolowo University (OAU)** to introduce students to blockchain fundamentals and how they can participate and benefit in the ecosystem. See video highlights: UNILAG event (https://youtu.be/OWn0iCnf2Gg) and OAU event (https://youtu.be/c75iIr9aYf4)
- **Community Building**: Established an active **WhatsApp group** and other social media platforms and engaged **university tech clubs** to sustain learning and collaboration.
- **Industry Exposure**: Connected students with experts through **keynote sessions and panel discussions**, broadening their career opportunities in Web3.
- **Resource Development**: Launched a dedicated website (https://vinuchainafrica.github.io/) to facilitate student engagement and event participation.

## **Impact Measurement Report**

### **Quantitative Impact**
- **300+ online registrations** across two major universities.
- **70+ attendance rate**, indicating strong interest.
- **Growing social media presence** from event attendees, fostering continued engagement. See more here https://www.instagram.com/vinuchain_africa/
- **Sponsored about 20 students** for the **O3 Finance School virtual blockchain bootcamp** *(see link here: https://x.com/o3financeschool/status/1820747174499557543)*.
  
### **Qualitative Impact**
- **Student Testimonials & Feedback**: Participants expressed enthusiasm about blockchain career paths and interest in further learning. See events' video highlights for more.
- **Event Media & Documentation**: **Photo galleries & highlight videos** showcase student engagement and outreach success. Access to the event photos is available upon request.
- **University Partnerships**: Established relationships with **Microsoft Learn Student Ambassadors & Web3 UNILAG** to support future Web3 educational initiatives.
- **Industry Partnerships**: Collaborated with **CryptoForte, BoundlessPay, and other prominent entities** in the blockchain space for past events.
- **Future Training Initiatives**: Currently working with **O3 Finance School** to plan an **exhaustive live training blockchain bootcamp**.

VinuChain Africa University Outreach is **laying the foundation for a robust and sustainable blockchain ecosystem in Africa**, empowering students with the **skills and knowledge** to innovate and contribute to Web3.

# **Proof of Work (PoW) on Blockchain Education**

VinuChain Africa University Outreach, albeit launched in early last year, has actively contributed to **blockchain education** and **community building** through structured university engagement programs, hands-on learning initiatives.

## **Blockchain Education Activities**
### **University Outreach & Training Programs**
We have successfully organized **blockchain education events** at **University of Lagos (UNILAG)** and **Obafemi Awolowo University (OAU)**, focusing on:

- **Blockchain Fundamentals & Overview** ‚Äì Introducing students to **decentralization, smart contracts, and the general ecosystem**.
- **Careers in Blockchain** ‚Äì Providing insights into **career pathways in Web3**, including **development, security, and governance**.
- **Hands-on Workshops** ‚Äì Enabling students to **interact with blockchain platforms and deploy smart contracts**.

### **üìå Impact Metrics**
- **300+ student registrations** across two events.
- **35 students onboarded** into deeper blockchain learning via sponsorships for a **3-month virtual blockchain bootcamp in collaboration with O3 Finance School**. See announcement here (https://x.com/o3financeschool/status/1820747174499557543).
- **Long-term engagement** through **dedicated social media platforms** and university partnerships. See our social media links in our profile. Our partners are also listed on the homepage of our website (https://vinuchainafrica.github.io/)

## **Supporting Proof (Links & Media)**
- üì∏ **Event Photos**: *UNILAG Event Gallery* (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1T36Qr8HFcjorOCGKEO6eJMHWdZqP0hAY?usp=drive_link), *OAU Event Gallery* (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1GlD_LYztEleaf5zADiJJ6rPx094Lhegl). Feeback from one of our facilitators (https://www.linkedin.com/posts/victor-solomon-3807631a2_blockchain-vinuchain-universityoutreach-activity-7211700386112430081-rf-O?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android)

- üé• **Event Highlight Videos**: *UNILAG event* (https://youtu.be/OWn0iCnf2Gg) and *OAU event* (https://youtu.be/c75iIr9aYf4). 

---

Through these initiatives, we are **bridging the gap between academia and blockchain technology**, fostering the **next generation of Web3 innovators**. üöÄ

project.title: VinuChain Africa
project.description:
# Empowering Tomorrow‚Äôs Blockchain Innovators

Imagine a future where every university campus buzzes with blockchain innovation and every student is equipped to drive positive change in the digital economy. The VinuChain Africa University Outreach Program is designed to transform this vision into reality by bringing blockchain education, hands-on workshops, and dynamic networking opportunities directly to universities.


## What the Project Is About

Our initiative is a comprehensive outreach program that introduces blockchain technology to the next generation of developers and innovators. Through engaging campus events and practical workshops, we are building a vibrant community of tech-savvy students at key African tertiary institutions. While a dedicated educational video series is in the planning stages, our current focus is on creating live, impactful experiences that empower students with the skills and insights needed to explore real-world applications of blockchain, fostering early adoption and grassroots advocacy for this transformative technology. 


## Key Elements & Value Proposition

- **Educational Empowerment:** Delivering cutting-edge blockchain education that equips students with practical skills and insights, preparing a generation ready to innovate.

- **Community Building:** Creating robust networks of enthusiastic blockchain advocates who drive adoption and inspire change on campus.

- **Proven Success:** Our previous events have sparked a genuine interest in exploring the possibilities of blockchain technology, encouraging participants to think more deeply about engaging with this evolving field.

- **Sustainable Impact:** With measurable outcomes from past initiatives, our program is committed to driving both educational and economic transformation in academic communities.

- **Future Expansion:** While we plan to roll out a dedicated educational series in the near future, our current events lay a strong foundation for continuous growth and engagement.


## Why Support This Initiative

Your support is an investment in the future of technology and in the emerging talent pool of Africa‚Äôs universities. By contributing, you help expand this transformative program, enhance grassroots blockchain adoption, and foster a sustainable ecosystem of innovation and entrepreneurship.


**Join Us in Shaping the Future**

Be part of a groundbreaking movement that redefines education and innovation. High-quality photos and video highlights from our past events vividly showcase the energy and success of our initiatives. 

üöÄ **Together, let‚Äôs ignite a passion for blockchain innovation and create a future full of possibilities!** üî•

üì¢ **Stay connected with us on our other social media handles!**  
üì∏ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/vinuchain_africa/

project.title: Ugodev
project.description:
About  

My name is Ugochukwu Anthony, aka Mr. Ugodev, and I hold a BSc in Mathematics from Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, Kaduna. My crypto journey began with free mining like PI and CORE, but my deep dive into the industry started in 2022. Like many, I struggled with the complexities of blockchain and DeFi until Xenon Academy‚Äôs mentorship provided the guidance I needed to fully embrace Web3. Since then, I‚Äôve immersed myself as a builder, educator, and advocate in the space.


---

Web3 Impact & Contributions  

Over time, I have contributed to multiple projects and communities, taking on roles in education, community growth, marketing, and mentorship.  

KEY ROLES & CONTRIBUTIONS

Leadership role
-Project Advisor at Borderless Tech Club Kano  
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1883635594619973741
Community Involvement  
- Organizer & Speaker at Educational & Web3 Events in the Borderless community
- Actively sharing expertise in tech, finance, and crypto education  in the community
- Hosted free classes, mentoring 500+ newcomers in the community
    - Example of hosted sessions:  
    - https://t.me/c/2121121819/370/516
    - https://t.me/c/2121121819/370/553

Broader Partnerships and Educational Impact
- Tutor & Mentor - CREAITZ
Delivered a 7-day advanced crypto trading class, empowering learners with DeFi and risk management skills
  See resources from this partnership below:
    - https://lu.ma/6mn83smf
    https://t.me/c/2111303359/4009/15705
   https://t.me/c/2111303359/4009/15863

- Xenon Academy ‚Äì Community Moderator and Admin  
  - In partnership with Xenon Academy, I helped onboard over 2,000 students, guiding them through structured learning paths in cryptocurrency, DeFi, and blockchain technology.

- Apescreener ‚Äì Ambassador, Marketer & Shiller  
  - I contributed to awareness creation and market insights across X, Telegram, and WhatsApp, helping users discover profitable market opportunities.
https://x.com/MrUgodev/status/1814841242590535975?t=fncD34p0vsoEKYBhrW1dcg&s=19 delivering over 6000% in profits and reaching over 7k people and still generating revenue after one year
  - Example of my market insights and analysis:  
 https://x.com/MrUgodev/status/1851004574812782892


- Seeker in Partnership with Xenon Academy ‚Äì Crypto Onboarding & Training  
  - Onboarded over 800 newbies into the crypto space through structured training across WhatsApp and Telegram.  
  - Covered topics including:  
    - Introduction to Crypto & Blockchain https://t.me/theseekers2/46
    - On-Chain Analysis  https://t.me/theseekers2/102
    - Fundamental Analysis https://t.me/theseekers2/104
    - DeFi Tools ‚Äì https://t.me/theseekers2/105
 

CHALLENGES 

One of the biggest challenges I have faced while contributing to the crypto community is unreliable internet service, which disrupts real-time engagement during Q&A sessions, podcasts, and Twitter Spaces. These interruptions hinder knowledge-sharing, collaboration, and onboarding new members.  

Another major obstacle is the lack of high-quality gadgets. A slow system, subpar camera, and inadequate microphone make sessions frustrating and less impactful. Technical issues reduce efficiency, affecting content quality and engagement during live interactions.  

Addressing these challenges would significantly benefit the community. A stable internet connection and better equipment would ensure smooth, uninterrupted sessions, higher-quality educational content, and improved accessibility for learners. Clearer audio, sharper visuals, and seamless discussions would enhance the learning experience, empowering newcomers to navigate the crypto space effectively.  

To achieve this, investing in the right equipment is crucial. Reliable internet and high-quality gadgets will boost productivity and overall community engagement. Below are the key specifications of the equipment needed:
LAPTOP - HP EliteBook 840 G8 Intel Core i7-1165G7 32 GB RAM 1000 GB SSD 14 inch FHD Wi-Fi 6 Windows 11 Pro
MIC - Professional Dual Wireless Lapel Microphone.
Headset - V-Moda Crossfade M-100 Headphone
Internet - Starlink Standard Kit


CryptoAnchor: A Comprehensive Plan  

CryptoAnchor is my initiative to create a structured learning and mentorship platform for both beginners and advanced users in the crypto space. This project was inspired by my own struggles in crypto‚Äînavigating the complexities without proper guidance‚Äîand my mission to ensure that others have the support they need.  

Beginner Section ‚Äì Free 3 to 6-Month Mentorship Program  
A structured crypto education and mentorship initiative designed to onboard newcomers through:  
- Video sessions, podcasts, interactive Q&A, and practical training  
- Key topics include:  
  - Blockchain fundamentals  
  - Buying and storing cryptocurrencies  
  - Security best practices  
  - Trading basics  
  - Job opportunities in crypto  
  - Skill-building programs in both technical and non-technical roles  
- Goal ‚Äì Equip beginners with a clear roadmap and the skills to confidently navigate the crypto space.  

Advanced Section ‚Äì Market Insights, Collaboration & Professional Growth  
A dedicated community space for experienced traders, investors, and builders offering:  
- Market analysis reports, trading insights, partnership/investment opportunities, and job listings  
- Exclusive calls with industry experts  
- Weekly crypto newsletters and strategy breakdowns  
- Goal ‚Äì Provide advanced users with continuous learning, professional networking, and financial opportunities.  

Website & Community Structure  
CryptoAnchor will feature an online platform divided into:  
- Beginner Resources ‚Äì Educational guides, tutorials, and structured learning paths  
- Advanced Tools ‚Äì Market reports, investment opportunities, networking forums  
- Community Engagement ‚Äì Telegram, Discord, and private membership groups  

Vision & Mission  
- Vision ‚Äì To build an accessible, community-driven learning ecosystem where individuals can navigate crypto with confidence.  
- Mission ‚Äì Provide free mentorship for 2000+ beginners yearly and a collaborative space for advanced users to grow, learn, and connect.  

Implementation Roadmap  
1. Planning ‚Äì Define goals, build a core team, and develop the content strategy.  
2. Development ‚Äì Website creation, video and podcast production, and community setup.  
3. Marketing & Growth ‚Äì Community outreach, partnerships, and social media engagement.  
4. Launch & Expansion ‚Äì Onboard users, introduce strategic partnerships, and scale the platform based on demand.  

‚Äî---


Achievements & Recognition  

- Market Insights & Calls on Social Media  
  - Using my platforms on X and Telegram, I have consistently shared crypto insights, trading calls, and investment opportunities.  
  - Example thread:  
https://x.com/MrUgodev/status/1902078673634914385
  - Social Media Links:  
    - X: https://x.com/MrUgodev (influencing about 2000 people)
    - Telegram: https://t.me/houseOfUgodev (A guide for about 200 people.)

‚Äî----

People I Have Onboarded into Web3  

- Mrs. Nnenna Oluwatobiloba Yunusa ‚Äì Web3 Educator, Community Builder, Social Media Strategist, and Content Creator.  
    - Currently serves as the Social Media Manager at Borderless Tech Club Kano and Resource Personnel for Women in DeFi (WiD).  
    - https://x.com/montellobabyfa1

  - Nari Robert ‚Äì A DeFi specialist and airdrop hunter, who went on to become a Moderator at Borderless Tech Club Kano.  
    - https://x.com/Crypto_Boy016

  - Emmanuel Chinwenmeri Kalu ‚Äì A seasoned airdrop hunter and DeFi specialist, now working as a Community Growth Specialist.  
    - https://x.com/Wealthy1242080
Too mention a few.
  
Conclusion

My journey in the crypto space has been one of transformation‚Äîevolving from a curious newcomer to a Technical and Fundamental Analyst, an educator, mentor, and advocate for Web3 adoption. Through my contributions to various projects, training initiatives, and market insights, I have empowered thousands to navigate the industry with confidence. However, to scale my impact further and ensure seamless, high-quality educational experiences, overcoming infrastructure challenges is essential.

CryptoAnchor represents the next phase of my mission‚Äîbuilding a structured learning ecosystem that bridges the knowledge gap for both beginners and advanced users. With the right tools and support, I am committed to shaping a more informed and inclusive crypto community, where individuals are not just participants but active contributors to the future of decentralized finance.

answers.question: Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?

answers.answer:
Contributions To The Web 3 Ecosystem

Q1- Q2 2024
Hosted the ELIS 5 public goods tour to start things in the community about public goods, donation activities, Gitcoin and Gitcoin passports.
Hosted the first community hangout for the year
Partnered with Archway Nigeria and Secret Africa 
We hosted the second hangout to discuss non-coding tech skills and onboard our developers onto Lisk.
We hosted a tech space to teach our community members how to position themselves in the tech ecosystem better using social media.

Q3-Q4 2024
We teamed up with GDG Unn for their annual community event.
We had another community partnership with GIDA to train our developers.
We started planning our annual community event (B<>der/ess 3.0) and went on two campus tours where we onboarded approximately 100+ persons.
Later in the year, we formed a community partnership with Sofe Group and ended the year with another community hangout.

Q1 2025
The new year started with us moving into our community development's expansion and growth phase. We established a milestone partnership with the Center for Entrepreneurship and Development Research UNN to establish our hub. This served as our hangout spot for the community, and we hosted the first hangout of the year, where we used the byteonchain.xyz attestation dApp to onboard the community members.
We hosted a Twitter space for our community members to help them properly balance their tech and school life without having to sacrifice any of them.
Recently, we also had an onboarding session for newbies in the tech space, which involved intimating them with the various niches in tech, relating that to their everyday lives and helping them understand what niche suits them.

project.title: B<>der/ess Web 3 Product House UNN
project.description:
B<>der/ess Tech Club UNN Web3 Product House


As the Pioneering Tech community under Borderless dev hub, B<>der/ess Tech Club University Of Nigeria Nsukka has set the pace in her university community regarding web3 education, onboarding, collaborations, meetings and community growth.

The community's inception began after the B<>der/ess 2.0 with the theme. Becoming solutions. The then-watch party became a tech club after the event and has gone on to build developers, writers and designers. We recently got our product house, which we hope to use to do more onboarding and training and serve as a melting pot for more tech innovations and startups. Over time, we have established community partnerships with Secret Africa, Archway Nigeria, GDSC UNN, GIDA, Greenpill Nigeria, Light Bearers Community, CEDR UNN, Cryptosmarts, Lisk, Switch electric, Metering Protocol, Sofe Group, etc.

Below are our contributions over the past years in the Nsukka tech ecosystem and the Web 3 space generally. These links serve as PoW to our past activities while explaining the importance of helping fund future generations.

Contributions To The Web 3 Ecosystem

Q1- Q2 2024
Hosted the ELIS 5 public goods tour to start things in the community about public goods, donation activities, Gitcoin and Gitcoin passports.
Hosted the first community hangout for the year
Partnered with Archway Nigeria and Secret Africa 
We hosted the second hangout to discuss non-coding tech skills and onboard our developers onto Lisk.
We hosted a tech space to teach our community members how to position themselves in the tech ecosystem better using social media.

Q3-Q4 2024
We teamed up with GDG Unn for their annual community event.
We had another community partnership with GIDA to train our developers.
We started planning our annual community event (B<>der/ess 3.0) and went on two campus tours where we onboarded approximately 100+ persons.
Later in the year, we formed a community partnership with Sofe Group and ended the year with another community hangout.

Q1 2025
The new year started with us moving into our community development's expansion and growth phase. We established a milestone partnership with the Center for Entrepreneurship and Development Research UNN to establish our hub. This served as our hangout spot for the community, and we hosted the first hangout of the year, where we used the byteonchain.xyz attestation dApp to onboard the community members.
We hosted a Twitter space for our community members to help them properly balance their tech and school life without having to sacrifice any of them.
Recently, we also had an onboarding session for newbies in the tech space, which involved intimating them with the various niches in tech, relating that to their everyday lives and helping them understand what niche suits them.


These contributions wouldn't be meaningful without the backing we have gotten as a community, and our growth is attributed to our focus on public goods, personal development, and proper web3 education. A donation to us signals increased and improved blockchain adoption in our local community and globally, as we have plans for collaborations not just within Nigeria but in Africa at large, too. We aim to increase our bandwidth to as many African countries as possible and initiate cross-cultural tech exchange.
